Para Gabriel esta es la forma de generarse ingresos, cuando espera la cosecha, cultiva tubérculos y granos, nos dice que trabajará en ello hasta que las fuerzas de su cuerpo lo acompañen. En el caso de Gabriel es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, sin embargo fue aceptado por los integrantes de su banco comunal porque conocen de su esfuerzo y dedicación. En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para comprar abono para la época de siembra que se acerca.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 39 years old and lives with his wife. Since he was older than 20, he has been involved in livestock farming and agriculture with his wife. They go out very early to look for green grass for his animals to keep them healthy, because every Monday they sell their sheep at the cattle fair in a location near them. This is how Gabriel generates income when he waits for the harvest. She grows tubers and grains; she says she will work on this as long as her body allows her to. This is Gabriel’s first loan with MFP. However, he was accepted by the members of the community bank because they know of his strength and dedication. At this time, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the harvest-time that is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his fields for cultivation

loans.name: Jerrylin

texts.en:
“I want to raise my children well. I want to provide for their needs and help them build a bright future,” says Jerrylin S., a 31-year-old mother of three children from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Concerned about her children’s education, she joined the CEVI credit program in order to start a business and earn a living for the family. Jerrylin knows that with her husband’s income as a tricycle driver, she would struggle to send all of their children to school.

Jerrylin raises pigs in their backyard and wants to increase her profits from this venture. She is also looking into some other lines of work to increase the family’s inadequate income.

She would like a loan of $175 to purchase piglets and feed. She believes that by taking good care of the pigs, she would earn enough income to address her family's  needs.

CEVI has provided Jerrylin with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage, to help her grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Mận, 26 tuổi, ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. Gia đình chị có một con nhỏ 5 tuổi. Hiện tại thu nhập của  gia đình phụ thuộc vào công việc chăn nuôi, buôn bán hàng tạp hoá và tiền công làm nghề cắt tóc của chồng với thu nhập  2.000.000/ tháng. Chị mới tham gia vào Quỹ từ tháng 12 năm 2008, chị mong muốn được vay vốn với mức là 5.000.000 để đầu tư vào buôn bán  nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Mận - 26 years old - lives in Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. She has a young child that is 5 years old. Currently, her family's incomes comes from the business of rearing livestock, buying/selling of general goods and her husband's haircutting business with an income of 2,000,000 VND per month. She just joined TYM Fund in December of 2008. She hopes to borrow 5,000,000 VND to invest into their retail business to increase her family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail Business

loans.name: Yadicone

texts.fr: Yadicone est agée de 36 ans elle est marie et mere de plusieurs enfants .pour gagner sa vie elle vend depuis cinq (5) ans  des tissus  teintés pour femmes.Les revenus tirés de son activité plus permettent de participer aux depenses du menage.le pret sollicité lui permettra de renforcer son activité par l'achat de nouveaux tissus.
texts.en:
Yadicone is 36 years old, married and the mother of several children. To earn a living she has been selling dyed fabrics for women for the last five years. The income from this activity allow her to share the financial responsibility of the household. The requested loan will enable her to strengthen her business by buying new fabrics.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth F. is 37 years old. She is married and has two children - a boy and a girl. Both of her children are currently in primary school. Her husband works with a building construction firm in their community. Ruth lives with her family in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Ruth sells crates of eggs to make some income to support her family. According to her, she procures the eggs from the poultry farms in her community. Ruth sells the eggs at the local market square, mostly to retailers. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more eggs. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Selene

texts.es:
Selene R. y su esposo que poco apoco han ido construyéndole con ahorros pensando en el patrimonio de su hija. La casa es de interese social lo cual la ha ido haciendo cambios como pintura y mas habitaciones, pero ahora ella se esta preocupando por la seguridad de su familia ya que en la parte de enfrente le falta el portón. 
Selene mas que todo se preocupa por el bienestar de la familia ya que en el trabajo donde esta a veces tiene que salir de la ciudad y teme que le pase a su hija.
texts.en:
Selene R. and her husband have been building their house little by little with their savings, investing in it as their daughter's inheritance.

The house is from social services and they've been renovating it by painting and building more rooms. However, Selene is worried about the safety of her family because the front of the house is missing the gate door. More than anything, Selene is concerned with the well-being of her family as she sometimes has to travel for work and fears something will happen to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and building material

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl V. is a 28 year-old mother married to John, who is a rickshaw driver. The couple wants to establish their living before having a baby. She applied for this loan to finance the down payment on a motorcycle she wants to get, and to buy a sidecar for it. The new tricycle they want will be for rent, since her husband is presently driving their own unit. She hopes that they can cope with the monthly installments and save money to build a better house, for she wants to establish a stable family with her kids in the future.

loans.use: To finance a motorcycle

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Chhen S. was born in 1973 and is married with three children: one is married and lives independently and the others are single. One of her daughters is a sewing worker in a garment factory.

Mrs. S. and her husband make their daily income by selling fish in the local market. They normally sell fish that they buy from a wholesale market far from their house. Because the family's business is profitable and is growing, S. is requesting a loan of $600 to use as capital in the business operation and to decorate her house.

loans.use: To use as capital in the business operation

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is from the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is now 35 years old and already married to Ernesto Villoria Jr., 34 years old. They are blessed with two children: Erwin, 11 years old and the youngest is Jayvee, 10 years old. Both children are attending the primary level of education. Fely is very thankful for having a happy family and having a good bonding with each other.

Aside from the passenger tricycle that her husband manages, she is also engaged in a poultry raising business. With their income from their business activities, they can provide the basic needs for their family. But she plans to expand their business in order to earn more profit to save funds for the schooling of their children. For this, she is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 for both the maintenance of their motorcycle transport and her livestock raising business. She also wants to start a rice vending business to earn extra income. However, Fely said that she cannot do all of these at the same time considering the availability of funds. Thus, she is praying that her loan will be approved to be able to make her business successful. She believes that all her business plans, if pursued, will be of big help to her family. She hopes to become successful in the business by being patient and by exerting more efforts in doing her work. According to her, she will only believe that she has already achieved her goals in life when she sees her children finish their studies in college and find a better job.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing two more cows

loans.name: Edmarie

texts.en:
"I have been a farmer for 15 years. That is how I provide for my family's basic needs and for the school tuition for my children," says Edmarie D., 43 years old mother of three children. She also manages a small sari-sari store business. Edmarie wanted to open a small piggery in her backyard so that she will be able to send her children to good schools.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. The loan will definitely help her achieve a better harvest.

Besides the loan from CEVI she receives training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and farm inputs.

loans.name: Gwantwa

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Gwantwa M. from Mbeya. She is married and is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Since 2008, Gwantwa has been running a business purchasing and selling cereals. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about 50 USD a month. She is requesting a loan order to purchase additional stocks of cereals in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. Gwantwa thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cereals in bulk

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a member of the Upendo North borrower group in Kinyanambo. She is a 26-year-old woman, and she is married. She cares for 4 dependents. 

Regina started her own business selling charcoal 2 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 80,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Regina’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 TZS in order to buy more charcoal. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Regina hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.en: N. Haawa is a hard working lady who believes that without money, life is hard. She is a single mother of 4 children aged 14 – 3 years ensuring that all their needs are met with the urgency they desire. She has a business of keeping poultry at her home in Walusubi for 3 years and the quality of chicks she gets enable her to stay in business and earn much. This kind of business is too competitive but since her produce is good, she is worried less about this. She is able to make 40,000/= as profit a week hence being able to save to her business and family. This is Haawa’s 1st loan with the group and she is planning to add more capital in her business by buying more feeds and booking more chicks for business expansion.

loans.use: Buying more chicken feeds and more day old chicks for farm expansion.

loans.name: Savior Group

texts.en:
Kennedy is forty five years old. He is married and a father with four kids who are currently in school. He is a dealer in hardware goods like nails, hammers, paint, roofing sheets, head-pans (containers with handles used in construction), etc. Through this business he has won for himself many customers who buy from his stand and he has added the sale of cement to his inventory. This, he said, has retained most of his customers who try to buy all their hardware goods from him.

Kennedy buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of goods. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include other items which are frequently demanded by his customers.

Kennedy is the leader of a trust bank group called “Savior”. He is the one sitting in the group photograph. The other members in this group are petty traders, food vendor, hardware sellers and farmers, etc.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of goods

loans.name: Airfield Short Cut Group

texts.en:
Airfield Short Cut is a group of 5 borrowers led by Edwina D., 35 years old and also a junior student of the Smart Institute (an academy and training college). She is a single mother with 4 children aged 9-18 years old; their educational levels are 4th-10th grade. She also cares for 4 siblings.

Edwina lives in the Airfield Shortcut area. It is north of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. It’s a community with mixed poor and middle class Liberians.

Edwina’s business is, she buys charcoal wholesale and sells retail to the residents of Airfield Shortcut. She has been running this business for 3 years and she is grateful to this business because both her own and the children’s school fees and their food comes from her business.

Edwina started this business with a small amount of capital but now owns a warehouse and wants to go forward and expand her business. Her good relations with her customers made her reach this far, and she wants to become a big businesswoman, travelling out of country to bring different kinds of goods to Liberia.

Edwina needs the loan to purchase more charcoal to fill her warehouse and make more profit to increase her capital. She dreams of graduating from university and giving her children a education for their future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to fill her warehouse

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is a fish vendor. She is 45 years old and happily married to Noli. Her husband is responsible for cultivating their rice field while Florida is busy in selling fish in their village. The couple is blessed with two children: Noel - 22 years old, who just finished 2nd year college; and the youngest, Nelson - 17 years old, in 1st year college. Florida’s family lives peacefully in their village.

Florida is hoping that she will be able to develop her fish pond so that she can have more fish to sell and increase her income. Her family members are very cooperative and that is why they are happy and thankful.

Florida would like to expand her fish pond but her capital is not enough to sustain the daily feed supply of her fish. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 which will be used to purchase a feed supply. She is hoping that her loan request will be approved.

loans.use: To buy a supply of fish food

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en:
Meralyn M. is from the village of Purok 3, Valencia City. She is 22 years old. Meralyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Meralyn owns & operates a business buying and selling spices and a variety of vegetables in the local community. Meralyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Meralyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meralyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Meralyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo Pangilinan, Jr. is also known as "Don-Don" in his village located at Barangay Bagahabag, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is now 31 years old and still single but he wants to help his siblings with their studies. Moreover, he also wants to be financially prepared before he gets married so that he can support his future family.

Don-Don operates his jeepney everyday from Solano to Bayombong and from Bayombong to Solano. According to him, he is able to earn a net income of Php 400 daily which he uses to acquire their basic needs and to support the schooling of his younger brothers and sisters.

Because of his interest in increasing his income, Don-Don applied for loan of Php 5,000 from Kiva lenders which he will use for the maintenance of his jeepney. He is looking forward to the approval of his requested loan.

loans.use: To use for the maintenance of his jeepney

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Lerma's Group

texts.en:
Lerma D. C. is from the village of Taguntungan Baggao in Cagayan. She is 42 years old. Lerma is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Taguntungan Group."

Lerma is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lerma raises and sells pigs. Lerma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lerma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lerma is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Lerma's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza S. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Flordeliza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Flordeliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela A. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old. Shiela is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Shiela operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling motorcycle spare parts and accessories in the local community. Shiela has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2007, Shiela joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shiela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from GDMPC. Shiela is requesting a new loan of 13,061 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Shiela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nori

texts.en:
Nori S. is 45 years old. She is married and a mother of two children who are in school. Nori started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses. She also needed her own income in order to afford her home. Nori began selling teenagers clothing and shoes 10 years ago. She had always liked sales and the business did well after it started. Since then, she has continued to sell clothing. To expand her business Nori is requesting a loan of $1500 USD. She would like to earn more and to meet all of her children’s expenses.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. It is also a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 34 years old, married to Serah Njeri, and they have four school going children. He has been transporting goods for his clients to the market using a cart pulled by his donkey in Naivasha town for the last five years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He plans to buy another donkey and a cart to help him move more goods to the market, at the same time also improving his income. He will employ someone else to operate the new cart.

In future he plans to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy another donkey.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Maria A. N., tiene una fritanga en su casa de habitación en el barrio Roberto González, y a la vez la señora A. hace enchiladas (enfrijoladas) que las elabora y las entrega a las escuelas el crédito la señora lo utilizo para comprar una mesa en donde pueda colocar las enchiladas fritas esto con el fin que su trabajo se le haga más fácil y mas cómodo para ella.
Ella antes trabajaba como domestica en una casa y luego ella decidio tener su propio negocio sacando a vender enchiladitas en su casa con C$ 200.00 que fueron ahorro.
Su negocio empieza a la 5 de la tarde hasta las 10 y media de la noche, compra por las mañanas y frie a partir de las 12 del día tiene 3 hijos viven con ella pero ninguno a su cargo pero si le ayuda en lo que puede a dos nietesitos, tiene 4 años y medio de trabajar con ceprodel, financiamientos que le han ayudado a acondicionar su fritanga y su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Maria A. N. has a fritanga (a stand that sells fried food) in her home in the Roberto González neighborhood, and at the same time, Señora A. makes enchiladas (with beans), which she prepares and delivers to schools. She will use the loan to buy a table where she can place the fried enchiladas, with the goal that her work will be easier and more comfortable for her. She used to work as a domestic worker in a house, and then she decided to have her own business, selling enchiladas in her house with C$200.00 (Nicaraguan cordobas) which she had saved. Her business begins at 5 in the afternoon and goes until 10:30 at night. She shops in the mornings and fries after 12 noon. She has 3 children. They live with her, but she does not support them. But she helps her two grandchildren with what she can. She has worked for four and a half years with CEPRODEL, obtaining loans that have helped her arrange her fritanga and her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil, bananas, yucca, and a table

loans.name: Rolene

texts.en:
Rolene C. is a business-minded woman who hopes and dreams that someday her business will not only be selling fish but through the loan she is requesting from Kiva through ASHI that she will be able to purchase her own motor boat for a fishing business. Her husband will be the one to manage the business and for him to have his own business to manage too. Proceeds from their business will help Rolene achieve her aspiration of graduating her two children (4 and 14 years old) from college. 

Despite the many trials in life that Rolene had been through, even in her membership in ASHI and the relationship of her group members, she remains strong, active and determined to reach her dreams.

For a microfinance that uses Grameen methodology, ASHI being the first practitioner in the field saw how these poor women mothers work hard to earn money for the cash flow of her family and to provide her children a better life. Because micro-credit ASHI is extending to these women is delivered directly in their villages and in the doorstep of their house, together with the loan handed over to them is giving them hope that someday they will “rise above poverty” (direct translation of Ahon Sa Hirap, in English).

loans.use: To purchase a motorboat for fishing.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comite Kuña Gaupa es una asociación D. mujeres con ganas D. salir adelante mediante el esfuerzo y el trabajo que las mismas unidas relizan.
Cada un D. las integrantes ademas D. trabajar en forma conjunta con las demas socias, tiene un actividad independiente..
El comite recibe capacitación D. asesoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya en cuanto al manejo D. negocios, elaboración D. presupuestos y planificación D. actividades..

La Señora Olga Lidubina G. D. es una D. las integrantes, ella es soltera, tiene 1 hijo, un varón D. profesión Estudiante cursando el 6to Curso D. 17 Años D. edad.

La Sra. Olga es una mujer muy activa, hace 20 años que se desemP. como Artesana, su rubro principal siempre fue la Artesanía, al igual que toda su flia.

Con el crédito ella adquirirá materiales que como telas, hilos D. colores y D. varios tipos(lana. finos, grueso, D. bordar, para tejidos),  estos son materia prima que podrá mejorar los trabajos en artesanías que ella produce y al mismo tiempo, producirá en mayor cantidad para satisfacer la gran demanda y D. esta forma incrementar sus ingresos. 

Olga es una mujer que colabora ayuda a su comunidad, es muy solidaria, ella logró que que muchas señoras se unan al grupo D. esa forma las mismas tuvieron la oportunidad D. acceder a un préstamo.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Gaupa” Committee is an association of women with a desire to get ahead through hard work in their businesses. Each is involved in her own activity, as well as being involved with the group. The group receives mentoring from “Fundación Paraguaya” and they learn how to run a business, creating revenue, and planning. Olga is one of the members. She is a single mother with one 17 year old son who attends school. Olga has been a very active artisan for the past 20 years and would like to use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as fabrics, thread of various colors and types (yarn, fine thread, thread for borders, thread for sewing, etc). These supplies will allow her to improve her artisan work as well as enable to produce more items to satisfy demand and improve her income. Olga is very helpful within her community and was instrumental in forming this group and providing its members with the opportunity for obtaining loans.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ice-cream to sell.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’attiégou à Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 1995, elle a beaucoup d’expérience dans ce commerce. La pluie de ces derniers temps a détruit son stock de marchandises, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This woman is 47 years old. She is married and mother of three children. She lives with her family in the Attiégou quarter of Lomé. To make a living, she works trading wood charcoal. She began this work in 1995 and has much experience with it. The last rains destroyed her stock of product, and she wishes to restock. She is asking for a WAGES loan to purchase 20 bags of wood coal.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of wood coal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seeds (operating capital)

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe - Cusco Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN D. GUADALUPE - CUSCO”; Nuestros socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y se reúnen cada primera semana D. mes en el distrito D. Huanchac provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Mercedes, la socia tiene 45 años D. edad es separada y ahora es madre soltera; tiene 2 hijos, D. los cuales uno D. ellos es independiente y el otro hijo aún estudia en el instituto y ella lo apoya económicamente y moralmente, La socia comparte sus actividades del hogar con la administración D. su librería Amauta;  Nuestra socia tiene situada su librería en la Av. D. la cultura y ella contrató 2 jóvenes para que le apoyen en la librería. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como cuadernos, lápices, y diferentes útiles escolares y D. escritorio en general.
Los otros socios del banco comunal, se dedican a todo tipo D. actividades: atención D. un hostal, manualidades y venta D. pasto, servicio D. taxi, fotocopias, impresiones, técnico electricista.

Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Cusco Virgen D. Guadalupe Community Bank. They live in the city of Cusco and meet the first week of the month in Huanchac district, in Cusco department. One of our members is Sra. Mercedes. She is 45 years old, separated from her husband, and is now a single mother. She has two sons, one of whom is independent and the other is a student at a local college. Mercedes helps him financially and provides him with moral support. As well as her household duties, she runs a bookstore called Amauta which is located on Avenida D. la Cultura. Two young people help her in the store. Mercedes is asking for a loan to buy stock such as notebooks, pencils, and other school and office supplies. Other members of the community bank have a variety of jobs: running a guesthouse, handicrafts, selling fodder, taxi service, photocopying service, printing business, electrician. They are grateful for the valuable help provided by the loan and promise to pay it back according to the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, and other school and office supplies

loans.name: Pure Heart Borrower Group

texts.en:
Charcoal is obtained from burning a piece of fresh timber in the absence of oxygen. It is one of the most common sources of energy for cooking in every traditional home. It is also the most affordable. Selling charcoal is one the lucrative businesses for many women like Juliana. Juliana is a 50 year old woman. She purchases bags of charcoal in bulk and retail to customers in her community for the past two years. She also trades in plastics materials. She plans to invest the loan to purchase more bags of charcoal and plastics to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market.

Juliana is divorced and the mother of five children from age 6-22 years. She describes herself as hard working and resourceful mother who dreams of owning a shop and providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El Señor Ruben C. G. es soltero y trabaja para mantener a su familia, su madre y sus dos hermanas menores ya que su padre se separo de su lado  cuando el tenia 18 años y desde entonces él se hace cargo de su familia.

Ruben C. G. es una persona  muy dedicada a su trabajo, el trabaja en el sindicato de moto taxis “CARRASCO” que es el único ingreso familiar que tiene, el trabaja como chofer ya que el no cuenta con una motocicleta por lo cual genera un ingreso para mantener y ayudar a su familia y sus hermanos.

El señor Ruben C. G. a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para la de una Motocicleta para así poder así contar con una herramienta propia y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de madre y sus hermanas y un futuro y bienestar  mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Ruben C. G. is single, and works to support his family, his mother, and two younger sisters. His father left the family when he was 18 years old, and since that time he has taken on this responsibility. Ruben C. G. is a hard worker, working for the Carrasco motorcycle taxi union, which is the only family income he has. He works as a driver because he doesn’t own a motorcycle, and this way generates income to support and help his family and his siblings. Ruben C. G. came to the office in search of a loan to purchase a motorcycle, and thus have his own means to generate more income for the wellbeing of his mother and sisters, and a better living and future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for taxi service

loans.name: Juana Teodora

texts.es:
Juana Teodora es una madre D. familia D. 68 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y su ultima hija en el distrito D. TambogranD.,un distrito agrícola que produce principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicado a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores D. agricultura desD. hace muchos años, cuenta con media hectárea D. cultivo en donD. siembra mango, después D. cada temporada D. cosecha ella ofrece en venta las frutas que recolecta a las diversas plantas D. tratamiento que están ubicadas en la zona, estas fábricas están encargadas D. procesar las frutas para luego exportarlas. Este procedimiento es utilizado por la mayoría D. agricultores D. la zona, lo que hace que el cultivo D. frutas sea la principal actividad económica del lugar.

Juana desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo D. mango, para hacerlo se ha propuesto comprar fertilizantes que brinden mejores nutrientes a sus árboles frutales, lo que derivará en una buena cosecha. Para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su esposo y juntos sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Teodora is a 68 year old mother with a family. She is married and lives with her husband and youngest daughter in the TambogranD. agricultural district where fruit for export is the primary product. The district is a part of the Piura province within the region of the same name, which is located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She’s been working in agriculture for many years. She has half a hectare of land where she raises mango. Following each harvest season, she offers for sale the fruit that she collects from the various treatment plants located throughout the zone. These factories are charged with processing the fruit for export. This process is used by most of the farmers in the zone, making the raising of fruit the chief economic activity. Juana would like to maintain her mango crop and to do it has proposed buying fertilizer that will offer nutrients to the fruit trees, producing a good harvest. In order to reach her goal, she has requested her first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa. She is a hard working woman very dedicated to her family. Her greatest desire is to continue to work in order to help her husband move the family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena A. is from the village of Tigbao. She is 45 years old and is married with two adult children. Elena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Bob

texts.en: Twenty-year-old Bob wants a loan to construct a commercial house for income generation. He is married with two children. He is in the motorcycle transport business. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a semi-permanent house in which he lives. He dreams of building a permanent house, educating his children, and acquiring a motor vehicle for his transport business.

loans.use: construction of a commercial house for income generation

loans.name: G/s Genesis Group

texts.es: Julia Alejandrina P. tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside en la Colonia El Eden junto a sus tres hijos de 27, 25 y 24 años. Julia comenzò vendiendo medicinas naturales de forma ambulante, en la mayoria del tiempo recorriendo a pie gran parte de la ciudad mientras sus hijos iban a la escuela. Luego de un tiempo cambiò de negocio y actualmente por el dia se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para mujeres y niños, blusas, faldas, sandalias, pantalones largos y cortos; por la noche trabaja en un pequeño Restaurante que se llama Las Dos Torres donde elabora una variedad de golosinas. Julia solicita el prestamo de Lps. 7,000 para comprar una mayor cantidad de ropa sobretodo estilos que esten de moda, de manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas llamando la atencion de mas personas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y no seguir pagando alquiler, y una pequeña tienda y que le permita seguir obteniendo ganancias ya que tiene un nieto a su cargo y necesita el dinero para poder llevar el sustento a su hogar. Sus companeras de grupo son Lilian y Luisa. Lilian se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, y tambien trabaja en el Restaurante La Dos Torres pero por el dia, solicita un prestamo de Lps. 5,000. Luisa se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosmeticos, tiene un problema de salud en sus ojos, ella sufre de Cataratas, solicita un prestamo de Lps. 5,000. Este es el segundo prestamo que el grupo solicita en FAMA y son han demostrado que son personas muy responsables en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Julia Alejandrina P., 48, is a single mother living in the El Edén neighborhood with her three children who are 27, 25 and 24 years of age. Julia started to sell natural remedies in an itinerant way spending most of the time walking the streets of a large part of the city while her children were in school. After some time, she changed her line of work and now she sells women’s and children’s underwear, blouses, skirts, sandals, long and short pants during the day. At night she works in a small restaurant called Las Dos Torres where she prepares a variety of snacks. Julia is asking for a Lps. 7000 loan to buy a larger amount of clothes, especially those in season so that she can attract more customer attention and increase sales. Her dream is to own her own home and stop paying rent and to have a small store that will allow her to continue to earn income because she also has a grandson under her care and needs money to support her household. Her fellow group members are Lilian and Luisa. Lilian sells clothes and shoes and also works at the Las Dos Torres restaurant but during days. Luisa sells clothes and cosmetics. She has an eye problem, though: cataracts. This is the second loan the group has requested from FAMA and they have demonstrated that they are very responsible people with regard to their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Rocella

texts.en:
Rocella C. lives in the village of Siempre Viva Norte. She is 41 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She makes a living by raising livestock, especially pigs. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Rocella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid three previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock, feed and other supplies

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann S., 45, married to local farmer So Kimhour, (shown in the photo) 48, always helps her husband in planting and farming rice.  Vann makes bamboo baskets for the market. To construct the baskets, she and her husband often go through the village looking for bamboo, take the material  home, submerge it in water for almost a week, and then allow it to dry under the sunshine for three days. They then tear the bamboo into smaller pieces and proceed to make the baskets. Vann is now requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase more bamboo to resell to increase profit in her family.

loans.use: To purchase more bamboo to resell to increase profit in her family.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 46 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en una casa que esta a su custodia. Hace 9 años que tiene su restaurante, instalado en el interior de su casa, asimismo recibe la ayuda de sus hijas, que en su tiempo libre la ayudan en la atención y preparación de las comidas. Es así que sale todos los días a vender comida; su dedicación y su inclinación por la cocina hacen posible que su sazón sea del agrado de sus clientes, eso hace que su negocio se mantenga estable. Su clientela es por lo general obreros que laboran en construcciones, por lo que ha visto Marina que este negocio es muy rentable. Hoy se ha propuesto mejorarla de acuerdo a sus posibilidades en cuanto a la presentación de su local de ventas. Es su crédito número 20 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras de este préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de algunos ingredientes como menestras  y cereales por sacos que son lo básico para la preparación de su comida.
texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old and lives with her three children in her own home.  

For nine years she had her own restaurant, which is located inside her house.  Her daughters help her in the restaurant in their free time by preparing food.  This allows her to go out every day to sell food.  Her dedication and cooking skills make it possible for her to please her customers and maintain a stable business.  Her customers are mostly construction workers, so Marina has made sure the business is very profitable.  Now, she would like to improve her business according to the local opportunities.

This is her 20th loan with MFP, and she is very happy that she has a financial support and is known as a responsible person with her payments.  She is also thankful to be part of her communal bank, because all of the members are responsible and caring people.  She also thanks the people who will make this loan possible, because it will be very useful in the progress of her business.

With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients like vegetables and cereals that are the basics for the preparation of her food.

loans.use: Purchase basic products to prepare her food

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 44 years old, married, and has two children. He graduated from primary school. He will use this loan to purchase raw materials, plywood for the construction and a big saw. The borrower sells good quality at a reasonable price; many clients come to buy items for house construction from him. The borrower has a high reputation in the market. He can compete with other shops very honestly and humanely and that has made him keep a good business.

loans.use: purchasing a big saw and wood

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 23 años, convive con Luis, de 26 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, Luis, de 3 y Roly, de 5 años. Los cuatro viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Centro Huachirik. Hace tan solo 4 años, que viene dedicándose a la agricultura, sus  principales sembríos constan de café, plátano y achiote. Estos productos son muy solicitados en su comunidad, por eso Flor, en cada temporada de cosecha, contrata operarios, para que trabajen en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas y pueda obtener mayor productividad de estos frutos, ya que obtiene buenos ingresos y utilidades, pues los vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Pero consiente de sus necesidades y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, planea acondicionar un pequeño espacio en su casa, en el que piensa abrir una tienda de comestibles, para poder obtener mayores ingresos. La principal característica de Flor, es la responsabilidad; por eso es muy respetada en su banco comunal, donde todos son puntuales con MFP. Es el tercer crédito que tiene y se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, para sus cultivos de maíz híbrido y si el dinero le alcanza, obtendrá herramientas de trabajo para limpiar sus terrenos de la maleza que crece.
texts.en: Flor, 23, lives with Luis, who is 26.  They have 2 children: Luis, who is 3, and Roly, who is 5.  The four of them live in their own home, located in the indigenous community of Centro Huachirik.  For 4 years they have been farming, their main crops consist of coffee, banana and achiote.  These products are sought after in their community and so Flor, in every harvest season, hires workers to work on their 2 hectares of agricultural land.  This way she can get a better production of these fruits and obtain better profits and a better income.  She sells the products in the market of the city of Pichanaki.  But being aware of the needs of her children, and to give them a better quality of life, she plans to set up a small space in her house where she is thinking of opening a grocery store so that she can have better earnings.  Flor's most significant personality trait is responsibility, and for this reason she is well respected in her communal bank, where all the members are punctual with their payments to MFP.  This is Flor's 3rd loan, and she feels happy about the support being provided.  With the loan she requests, she will buy a number of bags of organic fertilizer for her cultivations of hybrid corn, and if there is enough money, she will buy some tools for her work to clear their land of weeds.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and tools to clear her land of weeds

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is a father of two adult children and has been working in mixed farming for fourteen years in his hometown of Nkubu, Kenya.  He sells his produce of peas, wheat, tomatoes, maize, beans, and milk at the local market.  He earns additional income from a retail shop he runs locally.

He requested the loan of 55,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank and fertilizer for his horticultural farming.  He says the purchase of a water tank and irrigation pipes will make his production consistent.  His challenges are unreliable weather conditions and an unregulated wheat market.  He praises Juhudi Kilimo for providing grace periods for the loans.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and farming materials

loans.name: Chhoeung

texts.en: The person shown in the picture is Chhoeung N. who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. Besides of farming business, she also raises a few pigs at her home. She is married to Bong Kong, age 40, who shares responsibility the family’s expense by fishing in the river around his house. This couple is blessed with three children; all of them are single and still under their roof at present. Chhoeung N. has a plowing machine for using on her farmland, and she can grow her rice crop at least twice time a year. Chhoeung N. now will use her loan for purchasing a few sacks of fertilizer her crop growing well, and the rest of fund uses to buy gasoline to fulfill her plowing machine in order to start plowing on her farmland for doing dry-season rice-field.

loans.use: Ta few sacks of fertilizer her crop growing well, and the rest of fund uses to buy gasoline to fulfill her plowing machine in order to start plowing on her farmland for doing dry-season rice-field.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S., 31, sells desserts, earning an income of 3 USD per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of 5 USD per day. The family spends 18 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity and 30 USD on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy rice to resell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar:
حسن في عمر 55 سنة متزوج وله 6 اولاد له في عمله 10 سنوات يعمل في ميني ماركت محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والمعلبات والسكاكر
لقد ساهم القرض السابق في زيادة مدخوله ودعم عمله وقد لقى دعم الكامل لديه مثابرة وجدية في العمل يريد من خلال طلب
قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء مواد استهلاكية والتوسع في العمل يحب التجدد والتطور يتميز بالمثابرة في العمل يحب ان يعلم
اولاده تعليم جيد لكنه يلقى صعوبة في تحسين وضعه
texts.en: Hasan is a 55-year-old husband and father of six who is very eager to provide his children with a decent education. Hasan has a decade of experience working at his Mini Market which sells groceries, canned foods, and confectionaries. He is very assiduous and earnest in his work, which he is always seeking to further develop and advance. Hasan’s last loan from A. Majmoua helped to increase his revenues, and he would now like to ask for another loan to purchase more consumer goods and further expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase consumer goods to resell

loans.name: Buhumuriro Bashubuzi Kweterana Group

texts.en:
Betty R. is the leader of the Buhumuriro Bashubuzi Kweterana group in Kyenjojo. She is 38 years old, married, and has 6 children. 

Betty has a retail shop in Busingye that has been in existence for over 2 years, in addition to her crop farming business. Her customers buys mostly daily home use products, and from these sales she is able to make 30,000 UGX in weekly profit. 

Betty is a self starter, hard worker and innovator.  These traits have enabled her to succeed.  Her dream is to have a stable family and a continuously growing business. She needs a loan to be able to buy more soap, sugar, flour, dry beans to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar, flour, dry beans to sell

loans.name: Asri Lestari Group

texts.en: After repaying their first loan correctly, "Asri Lestari" group has received a second loan. Ni Nyoman L. M. plans to use her share of this loan to buy four piglets. As for the cost of feed, she will bear that expense herself. She was satisfied with the results she got from the first period so she decided to expand her business. For the second period, she hopes that her business will do well, there will be no disease, and hog prices will be high when she sells her pigs.

loans.use: Buy more pigs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Siroko region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Esther has a small retail shop, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and maize flour for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  

In the future, Esther hopes to become a doctor after completing her studies. Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her manage to pay her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret is a forty-seven year-old, hardworking woman with four children.  She lives in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She trades in agricultural produce, and the business has been profitable.  Her challenge is price fluctuation. Her desire is to set up a food store.  Gorret needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 26 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of 1 year and 8 years old. She owns a shop in which she sells rice, soap, flour, etc. She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business while with the profits she plans to put aside some savings

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, flour, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Willmer

texts.es: El señor Willmer es ayudante: trabaja con su tío que es maestro albañil. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que el estudia la carrera de veterinaria. Así podrá realizar sus trabajos con mayor rapidez. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio en la ciudad de El Alto. Es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Wilmer is a construction assistant, working with his uncle, who is a master builder. He is requesting the loan to purchase a computer since he is studying to become a veterinarian and it will allow him to do his work more quickly. He lives in his parents' home in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. He is single and has no children. This is the first loan he has requested from Kiva partner IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Aya Efua Theresa

texts.en:
Aya Efua Theresa  E. is divorced and has two children. Educated up to junior high school, Aya Efua runs a provision shop and also sells waakye (rice cooked with beans, usually served with pepper sauce and fish). She has been in this business for five years. 

She now wants to expand her business and is taking a loan from Kiva to purchase more provisions to be able to supply her customers. Aya Efua plans to save up the extra earnings for her two children’s university education.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for her store.

loans.name: Senan Group

texts.fr: SENAN est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier à Xwlacodji à cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin). La représentante du groupe, Laurette Arlette (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est née en Février 1978 et est mariée à un revendeur nommé Arouna. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Laurette Arlette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Xwlacodji. Il y a environs trente trois ans que Laurette Arlette vit dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Laurette Arlette est une couturière de profession. Depuis sept ans environs, Laurette Arlette  exerce cette activité et vend également dans son atelier des produits de mercerie et des tissus. Laurette Arlette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Laurette Arlette sollicite un financement de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
SENAN is a group made up of two persons; both members live in the same neighborhood at  Xwlacodji in Cotonou (the economic capital of Bénin). The representative of the group, Laurette Arlette (who is raising her hand in the photo), was born in February 1978 and is married to a petty trader named Arouna. The couple have two children, both enrolled in school. 

Laurette Arlette lives with her children and her husband in Xwlacodji. She has been living in this neighborhood for about 33 years. The couple share in supporting their family.  

Laurette Arlette is a trained seamstress. For about seven years, she has been working at this trade and she also sells sewing notions and cloth in her workshop. She buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. This is the second time that Laurette Arlette has requested a loan from ALIDé, aimed at bolstering her business and better satisfying the needs of her clientele. .

loans.use: to buy sewing notions and cloth.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a 41-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 16 years old. 

Erna has been in the business of raising hogs for two years. She plans to user her loan to buy pig feed and vitamins. Each month, Erna earns 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her hog-raising business. 

In the future, Erna hopes to have a stable business that would help her sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
Munavar is a widow with two children. She is a hardworking and responsible woman. For five years, Munavar has been running a food stall, selling her products in a local market called Ganj. She sells sugar, bread, chocolate, sweets, and other items. Munavar is the only breadwinner in the family and she wants to provide for her children’s needs.  

Munavar is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase merchandise for her store. She would like to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy food items to sell

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is a market entrepreneur from Kumsangir, Tajikistan. She sells clothing in the city market and has been in this business for 15 years. She was forced to find ways to survive and earn her living which is why she launched this business. Firuza is seeking a loan of 7,500 TJS to increase her capital so she can purchase women's national clothing to sell. She is hoping to press on with her expansion plans and ultimately save enough to open a new vending facility in the future. We believe Firuza’s enterprising spirit will help her achieve all her goals and see her dreams come true.
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase women's national clothing to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is widow and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Violeta has been in this business for 25 years now. She works hard to support her family.

Violeta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Violeta would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marco Miguel

texts.es: El  sr. Marco tiene como actividad la carpintería, actividad  que realiza conjuntamente con su esposa , quien también colabora con el sustento de su hogar, el mismo que esta conformado por ellos y sus cuatro hijos que aun son menores de edad, es una familia muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de progresar, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de una maquina moldurera (maquina tupy), para así de esta  manera poder trabajar mejor y lograr mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Marco is a carpenter.  He carries out his work together with his wife who also helps contribute towards supporting their household.  Their family consists of themselves and their four dependent children.  Theirs is a very hard-working family and they have a great desire to make progress.  For this reason, they are requesting a loan to buy a Tupi machine for shaping / molding wood.  This will enable them to work better and make better income for their family.

loans.use: to buy a Tupi machine (for shaping / molding wood)

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is from the village of Arashenda. He is 25 years old and lives with his family: his wife Pikria, two-year-old son and parents. Solomon works in a local store selling construction materials. He gets a monthly salary. Pikria is a housewife. Solomon’s father works as an electrician on a TV tower. 

Along with their main jobs, all adult family members are involved in the family farming business. In particular, they have one hectare of agricultural land, where cabbage, tomatoes and cherry trees are grown. All harvested vegetables and fruit are sold locally to the retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,300 Laris. 

Solomon requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat plants for parasites. Part of the credit will be used to pay to the workers who will help the family with the seasonal work. After properly accomplishing the seasonal work, the family will get a high quality harvest. Their income will increase. Solomon and Pikria plan to use the increased income for house renovation, since it is already old and needs some repair. .

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and drugs to treat plants for parasites

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 43 years old and married, with 7 children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Elvie runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell.  Elvie has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 12 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.  Elvie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana María tiene 31 años de edad, su actividad es la venta de comida hace más de dos años que tiene esta actividad. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitar los diferentes platillos que ella elabora. Juana aprendió este negocio con esfuerzos propios ya que tenía la necesidad de sacar a sus dos hijos menores adelante. Este es el objetivo del financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, pollo, frutas, verduras, platos desechables, bolsas entre otros.
texts.en:
Juana Maria is 31 years old and her economic activity is selling meals. She has been doing this for over 2 years. The majority of her customers come especially to request the different dishes she cooks. Juana learned this business with her own efforts, because she needed to generate immediate support her 2 minor children.

And this is the object of her loan; to buy basic grains, chicken, fruit, vegetables, disposable plates, and bags, as well as other supplies.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, fruit, vegetables, disposable plates, and bags, among other supplies.

loans.name: Maritza Jacqueline

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, donde se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres de sus antepasados.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maritza, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de cuatro y de dos años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en un montacargas.
 
Nuestra amiga con la finalidad de ganarse la vida y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace varios años emprendió una sociedad con una tía  para vender comidas rápidas, ellas todas las tardes y noches se dedican a vender hamburguesas, sanduches, hot dog, jugos naturales y gaseosas de todos los sabores, lleva en el negocio 5 años y le ha ido muy bien. Por las mañanas también le ayuda a una señora en el acabado de cerámicas por lo cual le pagan un sueldo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pan, carne, salchichas, jamón, queso, frutas y gaseosas para preparar los alimentos. Lleva tres ciclos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la ayuda que le dan con los créditos y por la unión del grupo.
 
Su sueño es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The La Pila Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in La Pila, Montecristi canton. This area is well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture. There one can find a large variety of artisanry made by the locals in keeping with the customs of their ancestors.

Here we meet Señora Maritza. She is 30, married, and has two children ages four and two from this relationship. Her husband drives a forklift.

With the goal of making her living and helping her husband with the household costs, our friend started a venture with an aunt a few years ago. They sell fast food. Every afternoon and night they sell hamburgers, sandwiches, hot dogs, natural juice and pop of all flavours. She has had the business for five years and it has gone very well for her. In the mornings, she also helps another woman to put the finishing touches on ceramics, for which she earns a salary.

This loan is for purchasing bread, meat, sausage, ham, cheese, fruit and pop. These ingredients are for preparing her food. She has been in the Communal Bank for three cycles, each one year, and she likes the loans--they are a great help--and the unity of the group.

Her dream is for her children to never lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, sausage, ham, cheese, fruit and pop.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking businessman aged 44. He is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last two years, he has been operating a van transport business to earn a living.  He also practices poultry farming.  Previously, he used to sell clothes.  In the next 5 years, he wants to become successful in his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy tires for his van.

loans.use: To buy tires for his van

loans.name: Abajyamugambi Msny/ Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Alphonse  fait partie du groupe Abajyamugambi. Le nom du groupe signifie «ceux qui ont le même objectif ». Il a 54 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 18 à 28 ans, dont 3 scolarisés et il a 2 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est  2 ans de primaire.

Alphonse est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de semer une race améliore  du riz et utilisation des fertilisants. Dans les prochaines années, Alphonse voudrait acheter d’autres champs de culture de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne sa femme.
texts.en:
Alphonse  belongs to the Abajyamugambi group. The group name means "people with a common goal." Alphonse is 54, married, and the father of 4 children, 3 of whom have received schooling. He has an additional 2 people in his care. He was educated up the second year of primary school.

Alphonse grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for rice. His strategy for business growth is to sow an improved variety of rice, and to use fertilizers. Over the next few years, Alphonse would like to buy more fields to grow rice. With the profits, he plans to educate and take care of his wife.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Yolanda Robe

texts.es: Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 44 años, se dedica a la venta y compra de cochinilla y tara, tiene 3 hijos. Una amiga le invitó a participar en el Banco Comunal, siempre trabajó con Finca y siempre valoró las capacitaciones que le dan, las enseñanzas que le inculcan, trata todo de ponerlo en práctica, la responsabilidad es uno de los valores que mas aprendió y lo practica hasta hoy. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de cochinilla y tara, el gran sueño que tiene es poder tener una ferretería.
texts.en: Yolanda is a member of the Amaqella community bank. She is 44 years old and her business is buying and selling cochineal and tara (a tannin which comes from a native plant). She has three children. A friend invited Yolanda to join her community bank and she has always worked with FINCA. She has always valued the training sessions and the teaching that they provide and she tries to put it all into practice. Responsibility is one of the values that she has learned and she continues to practice it. Yolanda will invest the loan that she has requested in buying cochineal and tara. Her big dream is to set up a hardware store.

loans.use: to buy 'tara' and cochineal

loans.name: Antero German

texts.es:
El socio Antero tiene 39 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 3 hijos ; El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de distribucion de vinos y venta de vinos,el socio distribuye a diferentes negocios como tiendas de abarrotes y bares,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de distribucion y venta de vinos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar vinos al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antero is 39 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children. He continues with his business of distributing and selling wine. Antero sells to different businesses, such as grocery stores and bars. He works from 8am to 7pm. Through this job, he is able to move his children forward. Antero wants to expand his distribution business, so he is requesting a loan to buy wine in bulk.

He is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy wine in bulk.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
