Elisa P. lives in the village of Bocboc, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old, married, has three school-aged children and makes a living by buying and selling fruit such as mangoes and oranges. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Elisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Elisa has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 7,000 PHP to buy more fruit to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bermet

texts.en:
Bermet O. is a 53-year-old farmer with four children. Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 20 years, which is the means of subsistence for them. Bermet started this activity with initial capital of only 4,000 soms (KGS) and worked hard to achieve success. Due to her persistent and hardworking personality, Bermet managed to buy a truck which is now used for transportation. Today, she has two milk cows and one bull calf and plans to enlarge the number of her cattle. 

For this very reason, Bermet has applied for a loan of 120,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing two milk cows and two bull calves. With the revenue from this investment, she plans to broaden her business. All members of Bermet’s united family are doing their best to make the future prosperous and stable.

======================================

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Eugene

texts.fr: Eugene K. est aide technicien et travailleur de construction, et il est client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il a 42 ans, il est né à Rwanda, marie, et il a 3 enfants entre 7 ans et 12 ans.  Tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des tôles, les chaux, et les portes pour la construction des maisons à louer.  Sa stratégie est de construire une maison à louer a part de la maison d’habitation.  Il voudrait éduquer ses enfants, payer les frais médicaux de sa famille, et avoir la bonne sante pour la famille.
texts.en: Eugene K. is a technician's aide and a construction worker. He has been a client of ACB (Kiva Field Partner) since 2007. He is 42 years old, he was born in Rwanda, he is married, and he has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 12. All of his children attend school. He will use his first loan to purchase tiling, lime, and doors, in order to build rental houses.  He plans on building a house and to rent par of it. He would like to educate his children, to pay for the family's medical expenses, and to have his family in good health.

loans.use: To purchase tiling, lime, and doors.

loans.name: Kosiom Ole

texts.en:
Kosiom Ole M. is 24 years old, married and supports four people in the family. Kosiom is a farmer who raises maize on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last 6 years.

He learned about KADET from credit officers through their marketing. This will be his third loan. Kosiom plans to purchase farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming and also to pay school fees.

Kosiom's dream is to practice large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a conscientious man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 46 years old. Tessie is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Tessie wishes for her children to be successful someday.

Tessie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 28 years old and is married. For one year he has owned a small store which sells grocery items such as: lotions, soap, biscuits, sugar etc. His business is open from 7am until 5pm every day and he currently employs three people to help him.

Jean de Dieu has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase goods in larger quantities in order to get a better price. He hopes to earn more profits. With these profits he expects to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase goods in larger quantities in order to get a better price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es conocida por el buen sabor de sus comidas, hoy es dueña de la “Soda las Palmas” ( un pequeño restaurante de comidas Típicas)

Hoy ella necesita un préstamo de ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para la compra de electrodomésticos necesarios para su negocio como refrigeradora, congeladoras, microondas, y demás herramientas necesarios para mejorar su atención al público.
Su meta principal es tener una fuente de ingresos que le garanticen el estudio de sus hijos.
Ella es socia de la empresa de Crédito Comunal Raíces Capitales S.A, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de  EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Maria is known for her delicious meals and is the owner of the "Soda las Palmas" (a small restaurant offering typical foods).

She is in need of a loan in the amount of 594,000 CRC to buy appliances for her business such as a refrigerator, freezer, micro-wave oven and other items that will improve customer service.

He main goal is to make enough income to guarantee an education for her children.

She is a member of the "Raíces Capitales" communal bank which is one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy appliances for her restaurant

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel tiene 31 años de edad, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, convive con Jenny de 28 años de edad y tienen 02 hijos Javier de 05 años y Ruth de 02 años y juntos residen en su propia casa  donde reina la armonía. La labor que realiza Joel es labrar la tierra, donde viene cultivando plantas de cacao, café, barbasco y  piña, en total cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terrenos ya cultivados con estos frutos. Sus padres le enseñaron ha ejercer esta actividad, actualmente y con los ahorros que logró acumular pudo comprar su propia parcela. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo; donde viene trabajando 09 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de trasladar los productos para luego ser comercializados. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos perjudicando a sus sembríos. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de semillas de plantas de piña y  así poder renovar las plantas de café; por que los frutos de piña le generan mayor ingreso y en menor tiempo. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para así expandir su producción. Este su quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más plantas de piña y así poder renovar por plantas de café.
texts.en:
Joel is 31 years old and a native of the District of Santa Rosa. He lives with his wife Jenny, age 28, and their two children Javier and Ruth (ages 5 and 2 respectively). They have their own home where they live in harmony. Joel works on his land where he grows cacao, coffee, barbasco, and pineapple. He has a total of three hectares of land on which he cultivates his crops. His parents taught him how to farm and now he has his own land that he bought with the savings he accumulated. Joel knows how to hard. He has been farming for nine years and has the help of workers during the harvest season who are in charge of collecting the produce so that it can be sold later. Joel is very committed to his work and today he gets to enjoy the fruits of his labor. Although he generates good earnings, he is not pleased with the winter season because of the large population of insects that are present during these months that could harm his crops. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy pineapple seedlings to plant in place of coffee since these fruits generate more income in less time. For now, his greatest priority is to acquire additional farmland so that he can expand his production.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Joel knows that if he submits his payments on time, he will be able to access more loans from his Communal Bank with greater ease and few complications. The loan of 1000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy more pineapple seedlings to plant in place of his coffee crops.

loans.use: Comprar más plantas de piña.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Lilian has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for three years.  She also has a second business  elling local beer.  

To help expand her business, Lilian has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lilian hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Lilian hopes to expand her business. 

 Lilian is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by further improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gladys Estela

texts.es: La Joven Gladys Estela Sánchez Q., tiene la edad de 33 años, habitante del municipio de la concepción, juntos a sus padres y hermanos, los planes  futuro hacia su familia es poder llevar agua potable hasta la vivienda ya que actualmente tienen que usar barriles, baldes y un carretón para poder hacer uso del vital liquido, la Joven desde  hace doce años labora como agricultura ya que sus padres le apoyan con el cuido del cultivo de cítricos y otros productos que siembran para poder sobre vivir , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es el robo del productos   debido que por la noches no se queda nadie cuidando el cultivo . Gladys se siente contenta por la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondos Kiva siendo una persona muy humilde y de bajos recursos, pero si muy trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Gladys Estela Sánchez Q. is 33 years old.  She lives in the town of La Concepción together with her parents and siblings.  Her future plans for her family are to bring drinking water to their home since they currently have to use barrels, buckets and a cart to make use of this vital liquid.  Gladys has been working as a farmer for twelve years.  Her parents support her in caring for her citrus crops and the other crops that she sows in order to survive.

The biggest problem that Gladys faces is people stealing her produce since there is nobody looking after her crops at night-time.  Gladys feels happy with the trust that Afodenic has placed in her through their Kiva funds.  She is a very humble person of limited financial resources but she is very hard working and responsible.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 36 years old.  She is single and has 1 child.  She works hard to provide for her family.  

Mary Grace runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has been running this business for 9 years.  She also earns extra income from pig fattening and fishing.   She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as sardines, groceries, etc.  She has successfully repaid 5 previous loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Mary Grace aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtuya is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family live in the house which they built two years ago using a loan which was taken from our MFI. The loan was successfully repaid on time. 

Mrs.Enkhtuya has been running a newspaper and grocery kiosk at the bus station for 11 years. She has gained lots of experience in running the kiosk and she works  from 6:00 in the morning till 11:00 in the evening in rotation with her elder sister. 

This time Enkhtuya is planning to build a warm garage for her family car. The warm garage is essential in Mongolia especially in wintertime when the temperature reaches minus 40 degrees Celsius at night. The loan Enkhtuya is requesting will be used to build this warm garage for her family car.

loans.use: To build a warm garage for her family car.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a 55-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon, is married and has 2 children. Ali has owned a cafe for 12 years and has much experience in this industry. Most of his customers are friends, relatives and other community members.

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, for the first time, in order to buy necessary products, such as new cappuccino, Nescafe, coffee and tea trademarks requested by his customers. He hopes to do some small decorations for his business. Ali is very proud of the quality of his work and of the services he provides to his customers, and hopes to stay their number one choice in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary products to improve his business

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Dominga has a taxi business.  Her husband is the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools to maintain the taxi.

Dominga is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dominga hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools to maintain the taxi

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Mamudu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. He is 27 years old and was born in Kenema, in northern Sierra Leone. Mamudu is single with no children. He has been a businessman for many years now, selling top-up cards for all four mobile-phone networks. 

With the help of this loan, Mamudu and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. Mamudu will use his share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leone leones) to buy a large quantity of top-up (phone-use) cards to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of top-up cards to add to his business.

loans.name: Raimunda

texts.es:
Raimunda, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con sus dos hijos, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, inicio con el negocio por el apoyo de sus hermanos, trabaja en lo propio, no tiene un horario establecido pero si cuenta con experiencia.
Actualmente necesita comprar cerdos para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar la granja y crecer en el negocio.
Su objetivo es ser una comerciante de éxito y ofrecer a su familia una vida más confortable en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Raimunda raises pigs.  She lives with her two children.  She raises pigs.  She started the business with help from her two brothers.  She works on her own and does not have a fixed work schedule but she does have experience.

She currently needs to buy pigs to fatten up to sell later on.  This purchase will help her increase her farm and grow in business.

Her goal is to be a successful merchant and to offer her family a more comfortable life in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 24 years old and married with 1 child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Grace has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Grace has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Dairon León

texts.es:
A sus 21 años de edad, Dairon es un joven emprendedor que con la ayuda de su madre inició hace pocos meses un negocio de venta de helados y jugos que espera le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

Dairon es empírico y no sabía nada de este negocio pues desde pequeño ha trabajado al lado de su madre en una legumbrería en la que actualmente trabaja medio tiempo para dedicar el tiempo restante a su punto de venta. 

En el futuro este emprendedor espera tener un local amplio que sea reconocido en el sector y que además pueda ofrecer otros productos; por ahora necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas para hacer más atractivo su negocio y comprar algunos utensilios que todavía le hacen falta.
texts.en:
At 21 years old, Dairon is a young entrepreneur who with the help of his mother, a few months ago started a business selling ice cream and juices, which he hopes will allow him to improve quality of life for himself and his family.

Dairon is empirical, and didn’t know anything about this business, but ever since he was small he has worked by his mother’s side in a vegetable shop, where he now works only part time in order to dedicate the remaining time to his owns sales.

In the future this entrepreneur hopes to have a large store that will be known throughout the sector, and also to be able to offer other products.  For now, he needs a loan to make some adjustments to his shop so that his business is more attractive, and to buy some tools that he still needs.

loans.use: to make adjustments to his store and buy tools to make juices.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 25-year-old man.  He works in agriculture and has a project of raising sheep and selling sheep products to increase his income. Khaled wants to expand his project by purchasing more sheep and so increase his income, but the amount of money Khaled has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Khaled gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay to purchase more sheep and sell more of their products and so increase his income and improve his life positively and live in better conditions. Khaled is photographed in the FATEN branch office.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing more sheep in order to expand his project and improve his income.

loans.name: Nerng

texts.en:
Nerng, who is 39 years old, resides in the province of Siem Reap, an area full of ancient temples. She is a working for a tourism company and earns $5 year old. She lives with two nephews and two nieces. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food and $10 on other expenses.

Nerng would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her niece to travel to sell souvenirs. Nerng used to sell souvenirs near the temple, but she got two nieces to help her with the sales so she can work to earn more income. She wants to repair her house and establish one more souvenir shop for her niece so that her niece can have their own career.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her niece to travel to sell souvenirs

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is married and has four children between ages 3 and 12. She sells vegetables and has been doing this for the last 11 years. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family and increase her capital. She has always had a small amount of capital, which enables her to only make a small profit. She would like a loan to buy new kinds of vegetables to increase her profits. She will reinvest the profits into her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y cuatro hijos (12 años, 11 años, 8 años, 4 años y 1 año y medio), viven en casa propia en un terreno que recibió de una donación de un proyecto habitacional, la vivienda la ha construido poco a poco con los ahorros de la familia y con apoyo de la Fundación Campo.

Él aprendió de sus padres a cultiva maíz, también trabajaron como jornales en la zona, realizando actividades de preparación y mantenimiento de fincas agropecuarias, ayudante de albañilería, desde el 2004 empezó a trabajar como vigilante en una empresa hasta la fecha, en sus horas libres el se dedica a podar jardines, da mantenimiento a céspedes y a parte cuida a una propiedad privada.

El señor Juan esta solicitando un préstamo para construir el techo de su vivienda con madera aserrada  y hierro. Con esto podrá comprar hierro para soporte de las tejas, la madera aserrada ya la tiene. Con la construcción del techo la familia se sentirá con mejor seguridad, se reducirá la humedad dentro de la vivienda, considerando que el piso es de tierra. Esto les brindara comodidad y evitara la humedad y posibles enfermedades de tipo respiratorias.

Él desea a corto plazo construir un muro de retención de suelo en el terreno de su vivienda, en vista que se le esta erosionando y esta volviendo vulnerable su casa. Al tener su casa terminada el piensa dedicarse a la venta de ropa, hamacas, etc. Espera que la Fundación Campo pueda seguir apoyándolos como hasta ahora lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is 29 years old and lives with his partner and 4 children (12, 11, 4 and 1.5 years of age). They live in their own house on a plot of land that he was given by a housing project donation. He has built the house little by little with his family earnings and with the support of the Fundación Campo.

He learned from his parents how to grow corn as they also worked as farm labourers in the area, preparing and maintaining agricultural farms. He was a builder's mate and then from 2004 he has worked as a company watchman. In his free time he works as a gardener, trimming gardens, maintaining lawns. He also takes part care of a privately owned plot of land.

Señor Juan is asking for a loan in order to build a timber and iron roof to his house. With the loan he will be able to buy iron to support the tiles as he already has the timber. With the construction of the roof the family will feel more secure and the humidity inside the house will be less as they have a dirt floor. This will give them a more comfortable lifestyle and prevent the humidity and its possible respiratory tract illnesses.

He wants to build a short-term retaining wall on the plot of land where his house is located, as the land is eroding and making his house vulnerable. On completing his house, he is thinking of selling clothes, hammocks, etc. He hopes that the Fundación Campo can continue to support them as it has done so far.

loans.use: o build the roof on his house.

loans.name: Isabel Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Isabel es casada, tiene 7 hijos ya todos mayores D. edad e independientes, ella es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su labor diaria, ella se dedica en las mañanas a la elaboración y venta D. esteras (laminas tipo pared D. caña y/o matara) por todo el distrito D. los Aquijes, por las tardes trabaja en el área administrativa D. un colegio D. la zona; el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la construcción D. todo el cerco perimétrico D. su casa D. material noble ya que actualmente es D. adobe. Su principal sueño D. la Sra. Isabel es tener su negocio más granD.. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Isabel’s married and has seven children who are all independent adults now.  She’s a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her daily labors.  During the morning she manufactures esteras (sheets of woven sugar cane used for walls) that she sells throughout the Aquijes District.  In the afternoon she works in the administrative office of a local school.  She will use the granted loan to invest in the construction of a perimeter wall around her house maD. of substantial building materials since it’s presently maD. of adobe.  Isabel’s main dream is to have a larger business.  She is very grateful for the granted loan.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall around her house.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
This is Mercy, 28, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Romy, a driver, and she is a mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this, she also does manicures and pedicures for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mercy hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sdeung's Group

texts.en:
SD., 46, is married and has two children. She is a farmer living in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district. Also, she catches fish and grows vegetables to feed her family. She started farming 15 years ago. 

Currently, SD. leads a group of two female members. She and her group member have been with VisionFund since 2010 and 2009, respectively. She completely repaid her last loan with VisionFund. Now she is requesting a new loan. She wants to buy fertilizer for her rice field. This loan will enable her to grow more rice and she also hopes to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo believes that he will improve the general living conditions for his family and give them a better life through his hard work and patience. At the age of 39, he already has three children. He wants to educate all his children so that they will not have an occupation similar to his; instead they will have a better job some day. 

Due to the high cost of school equipments, foods, and allowances, he was not able to save for the operation of his business. For this reason, he needs to ask for a loan amount of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. He wants to earn more income to satisfy his family's needs and support the education of his children. He believes that when he works and strives harder, he will develop his business and absolutely improve their general living.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Futjox

texts.en:
Futjox is a 41-year-old married woman with five children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Futjox requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Lauro

texts.en:
Lauro is 53 years old. He and Jojita started their family 33 years ago. They have six children. They live in the community of San Juan, in the Isabela province. He makes his living through agriculture because he enjoys working in the fields. He learned this work as a child, thanks to his parents' teaching. Lauro has his own plots of land, where he sows corn and rice. Throughout the years, he has had to confront challenges such as plagues, low prices, and lack of labourers.

Lauro is an admirable family man. Because of her job, Jojita had to move to the city, so Lauro takes care of the children. He does all the cooking and cleaning as if it were nothing, on top of working in the fields. With the help of labourers, who he pays by the day for their labour, Lauro is able to speed up his agricultural chores. His sales are considerable in May. During that time of the year, the price of rice is around 11 Pesos per kilo. This is very good for him and his family. 

Lauro is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business. Lauro dreams to buy transportation services. With this, he will be able to save on transportation for himself and his produce in the future.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es: Maria Susana tiene  su actividad económica que es la venta de tortilla, ella ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en cual no es su primera vez que trabaja con crédito y ha sido una clienta muy responsable. Maria Susana emprende este negocio que a pesar de ser muy humilde es un ejemplo para sus hijos de cómo se debe ganar la vida honradamente. Maria Susana actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de materia prima y poder brindarles a sus clientes el servicio.
texts.en:
Maria Susana sells tortillas. She has already had credit from Fundación León 2000, so this isn't the first time she has worked with a loan, and she has been a very responsible client.

Maria Susana is undertaking this business, which, although very modest, is an example for her children of how to earn an honest living. 

At this time, Maria Susana is applying for a loan to invest in her business through the purchase of raw material, and to be able to offer service to her customers.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making tortillas.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is aged 25, and is single. He owns a boutique which he has been running for five years. With the loan he will add new items to the boutique such as cooking oil, soap, salt, rice and sugar. He plans to build a house from the profits he expects to obtain.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, soap, salt, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Cliffton

texts.en: Cliffton is a 32 year-old single man. He describes himself to be disciplined. He operates a carpentry where he makes sofa sets to sell. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a vibrant area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy materials for making sofa sets. His business goal is to open a furniture gallery within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a renowned furniture maker. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy materials for making sofa sets

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 41-year-old, smallholder farmer from Kitale area in the Rift valley region of Kenya. On the farm, she keeps dairy animals and grows crops and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming. Judith is seeking a loan to expand her farm by buying quality farm implements such as fertilizers. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output.

Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kitale. A few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Judith. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Judith. Her projections are that by the end of the first year she will be increase her overall farm output. Judith believes that it takes someone to help someone so kindly lend to her.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Pamphile

texts.en:
Born in 1961, Mr. L. Pamphile is a holder of a professional certificate in mechanics and welding. Married and father of seven children, he manages his own workshops in Afagna. Remarkable and appreciated for his fines works, he is very rigorous and honest when it comes to handling goods belonging to others. All those qualities make him a trustworthy and respectable man. As the business of Mr. L. starts to expand, the owners of the land he rent want to terminate the contract. Thanks to the first two loans he received, he was able to buy a piece of land and now wants to fully use it. His family burdens prevent him from setting up his new workshop while demand remains strong. Mr. L. therefore requested a new credit of $ 1,500 to outfit his new parcel of land, acquire more modern equipment and open a better performing workshop where there will be services of welding, mechanics, electricity, painting…This activity will make Mr. L., a real micro-entrepreneur and take care of his family.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC, a Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1961, Monsieur L. Pamphile est nanti d’un diplôme professionnel en mécanique et soudure. Marié et père de sept (07) enfants, il tient son propre atelier à Afagna. Remarquable et apprécié de par la finesse dans ses travaux, il est aussi rigoureux et honnête en matière de gestion des biens d’autrui. Toutes ces qualités font de lui un homme de confiance et de respect. Au moment où l’activité de Monsieur L. commence à prendre de l’ampleur, les propriétaires du terrain qu’il a baillé veulent résilier le contrat. Grâce aux deux premier crédits qu’il a obtenus, il est parvenu à acheter lui-même une parcelle et cherche actuellement à l’aménager. Le poids des charges de sa famille l’empêche de mettre en place son nouvel atelier alors que la demande est permanente. Monsieur L. sollicite alors un nouveau crédit de $1500 pour aménager sa nouvelle parcelle, acquérir un équipement plus moderne et ouvrir un atelier plus performant où il y aura à la fois des services comme soudure, la mécanique, la tôlerie, l’électricité, la peinture… A travers cette activité, Monsieur L. va devenir un véritable micro entrepreneur et prendre bien soin de sa famille.

loans.use: to outfit his new piece of land, and acquire more modern equipment

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Mrs. Celestina N. is 29 years old. She has two years of experience. She sells biscuits and bags of water to the community. She is determined to expand her business with the loan of $500.

loans.use: To buy more bags of pure water and cartons of biscuits

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Mammadov Arshad Khangulu Oglu began his animal husbandry business recently. He is a farmer from Beyler village of the Saatli region. He has five children. 
He spent his funds to adapt an old building for animal keeping and he purchased three heads of cattle. But big family expenses do allow him to invest more money in his business. So he decided use credit to cover expenses for purchase of two more calves and mixed fodder for them. He applied for 1000 USD to “Agroinvest” CU.

loans.use: Purchase two calves and feed

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A., a proud Dominican mother of three and owner of De Todo Elena, provides such refreshments as coffee and juice to her community of Barrio Dubeau in the northern province of Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic. With this loan, Elena intends on expanding her current inventory of coffee, tea, plastic cups, and silverware to better serve her community. As a mother raising Alfonso (age 11), Naomi (age 10), and Amauri (age 21), Elena uses the income from her business to supplement her husband’s full time job.

Note: Elena is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, tea, cream, and plastic cups.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru:
Ali A. was born in 1970 in the village of Bidzho in Aksu region. Now, he lives in the village of Tekle. Ali has been engaged in cattle farming for 8 years. He has 2 children. In 2007, he applied to Aksu branch of Normicro for a business loan to purchase sheep.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Али Амрахов. Родилься 1970 году в село Биджо Аксуниского р.на. Сейчас проживает в деревньи Текле. Занимаеться скотоводством. Имеет двоих детей. 2007 году обратилься Нормикро Аксуниского филиала чтобы взять кредит . Али хочеть купить по больше овец.Он уже 8 лет подряд занимаеться этим бизнесом.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of animals

loans.name: Carolina Esther

texts.es:
Carolina Esther suffered the terrible loss of her husband. Her husband supported her and their four daughters who are students and need money to buy school supplies. After the terrible loss, Esther gathered her courage to fight for her daughters and decided to start selling groceries, setting up a small place for this in her home. After some time, and with greater expenses, she decided to start selling meals, to have more clients.

Unfortunately, the place she has is not well set up with tables and chairs so her clients can stay and eat comfortably. This is why she is requesting a loan of US $ 400, which she is sure she can pay back within 4 months. With this money she will buy chairs and tables and merchandise for her general store. With your help, Carolina will be able to support her daughters, in spite of the grief she carries for the loss of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Carolina Esther, sufrió la terrible pérdida de su esposo, quien era el que mantenía a ella y a sus cuatro hijas quienes están estudiando y necesitan de dinero para poder comprar sus útiles escolares. Después de la terrible pérdida, Esther se armó de valor para luchar por sus hijas y decidió comenzar a vender abarrotes adecuando un pequeño lugar dentro de su casa. Después de un tiempo, y con mayores gastos, decide comenzar a vender comidas, para poder tener más clientes.

Sin embargo no tiene muy bien adecuado con sillas y mesas para que sus clientes se queden a comer a gusto. Por lo que hoy está solicitando un préstamo de US $400 y está segura que en un plazo de 4 meses podrá recuperar el dinero y pagarlo. Con el dinero comprará sillas y mesas y material para surtir sus abarrotes. Con tu ayuda Carolina podrá sacar adelante a sus hijas, a pesar de la tristeza que lleva por la pérdida de su esposo.

loans.use: Buying chairs and tables for food locale

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en: My name is Majeedan B.. I live in a small underdeveloped town, Raiwind, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of seven: three boys and four girls. My husband is a daily wage laborer and I offer midwife services to women in my area. My daughter is an artist and she embroiders clothes. She wants to buy an embroidery machine for her business. I hope she will do well because she is very ambitious and hardworking. Please lend us $225.

loans.use: Buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Kito D Group

texts.en: Rose N. is 35 years old and divorced with five children. She runs a small restaurant and also offers catering services. She and her four associates have applied for a loan to buy more food warmers for the restaurant and catering business. Rose would like to use the extra income she makes from the loan to buy a piece of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more food warmers to use in a small restaurant

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Sophia M. is 47 years old. She is married and has six children, who are between the ages of 15 and 26.  She has two other dependents, who are her grandchildren. In 2002, Sophia established a grocery business. Sophia now requires a loan in order to purchase a refrigerator and stocks of beer and soft drinks. 

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness. The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing.
Sophia's bar is a good place to get a beer for those who manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. It’s the kind of place where one can relax on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand.  The aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’  (kebabs made on an open fire) wafts around and there is good conversation.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and stocks of beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Abdurahimov

texts.ru:
T. Abdurahimov, who was born in1943, is married and has 5 children. His wife stays at home and takes care of the cattle together with T.. She also sells kurut (traditional Tajik snack) on a market. T. has a lot of experience and knowlege about cattle breeding. Currently, he has 2 cows and 8 sheep. Since during the winter season the cattle prices drop, he would like to purchase two more cows. That is the reason why he is asking for this loan.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдурахимов Туран 1943 года рождения имеет 5 детей жена домохозяйка занимается также с мужем скотоводством.Также она продает на базаре курут.Туран очень хорошо разбирается в скоте.Сейчас он имеет 2 коров и 8 баранов.Хочет в сезонн когда скот дешевый купить еще пару коров.Для чего обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To Purchase Cattle

loans.name: Elizabeth's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 10 years old. Elizabeth is a cloth seller, she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $150 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cloth selling, shop, coconut sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Julia America's Group

texts.en:
Janet, Julia, and Cenina have been part of the Alondras community bank for 8 months, 4 years, and 8 months respectively.

Janet is single. She is 18 years old and she studies administration at the local university. She uses a catalog to sell beauty products. Janet and her parents also own a vehicle that they use to provide public transportation.

Julia is a single mother. She is 58 years old and has 4 children. Julia has a grocery store that features public telephones in the store.

Cenina is married. She is 62 years old and has 6 children. She has her own grocery store where she sells vegetables. On weekends, she sells typical Ayacuchan food in her house.

Janet, Julia and Cenina need loans of 1000 soles (Janet), 1400 soles (Julia), and 600 soles (Cenina), which they will invest in rice, sugar, milk, ham, oil, and to maintain a car.

Janet, Julia and Cenina hope to have a business, a fleet of cars, and a large and fully stocked store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, ham, oil, and to maintain a car.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorn T. is a divorcee who lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has five children, two sons and three daughters. Four of her children are married; two of them live outside the family home and other two live with her. The youngest one is in school.

Mrs. Lorn has been employed doing farming for ten years. She is employed growing rice and planting vegetables in the farms around her village. Now, she is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to purchase a bicycle for her son to ride to school.

loans.use: To purchase a bicycle for her son to ride to school

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive U., 35, is married with 3 children and lives in the Vailele area of Upolu Island, Samoa. She has 3 years of experience making and selling "ice cakes" (flavored ices) to the general public and villagers 5 days per week.

Nive has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (US$83). SPBD loans are Nive’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to purchase plastic cups, concentrated flavors, and sugar for her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for flavored ices

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea S., age 44, lives in Phnom Penh, with his wife and two children ages 17 and 1. Their 13-year-old child lives away from home in order to attend a good school. Mr. Chea works as a soldier, earning around $2 each day. Mrs. Chea operates a business outside of their house. In the front she operates a grocery store.

To improve their standard of living, she would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, to open another business, ordering clothes from a garment factory to sell around her community. The loan would also help her to expand her grocery store's inventory. Between the two businesses she can now generate $8-10 in profit. (Mrs. Chea is pictured in front of her store selling groceries.)

loans.use: Add to their grocery store's inventory and order clothes to sell

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda U. is 35 years old. She is married and has a son of school age. The difficult living conditions of the family forced her husband to leave for Russia to find a job. For 5 years she has had a small business drying and processing apricots.

Dried fruits, especially dried apricots are very popular in Tajikistan. Besides they are very useful for the health. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, the business of Mavjuda is quite successful and brings in the stable income for the family, allowing Mavjuda to contribute significantly to the household and education of her dearest son.

Today Mavjuda requests 1500 Somoni (450 USD) for a term of 8 months. She is going to spend the loan purchasing apricots with the purpose of drying and processing them in order increase the range of goods she has for sale. Mavjuda expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. Support this woman of much strength and courage so she can keep working!

loans.use: Purchasing apricots in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Mukiljon

texts.en:
Mukiljon K. lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, and he works in the livestock business. More specifically, he purchases and sells livestock. Importantly, he is a very experienced livestock holder, and he proudly states that he has the appropriate skills to succeed in this line of business. Growing up, he grew wheat and rice, but now his income comes primarily through his livestock operations.

He has a good flock of animals, but he now wants to purchase one more pedigree bull. Therefore, Mukiljon is seeking financial support via a Kiva business development loan in the amount of 2,600 STJ ($775) over 4 months to capitalize on the seasonal nature of the business and to implement seasonal programs.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by implementing seasonal programs and to purchase another bull

loans.name: Rella

texts.fr: RELLA S. EST COMMERCANTE DEPUIS PLUS DE 15 ANS. ELLE COMMERCIALISE DES PRODUITS COSMETIQUES, TISSUS? DRAPS DE LIT. ELLE EST MARIEE DEPUIS PLUS DE 35 ANS.
texts.en:
RELLA S. has been a merchant for over fifteen years. She markets cosmetics, cloth, and bedsheets. She has been married for over 35 years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cosmetics, cloth, and bedsheets

loans.name: Elma

texts.es: La señora Elma, de 33 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos que están estudiando, vive con su conviviente, quien la apoya en todas sus decisiones. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas desde hace 2 años atrás, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el trato directo que tiene con sus clientes. Su le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un lugar muy transitado, y cuenta con una clientela selecta que degustan de su buena sazón. No tiene dificultad alguna ya que le va muy bien, por ello quiero seguir creciendo con su negocio. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Quiere mandar a construir una ramada (espacio al aire libre, cubierto por un techo a base de palos y ramas) y ambientar adecuadamente para vender sus platos más tranquila y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Elma, 33 years-old, is a mother of 5 children that are students. She lives with her partner, who supports her in all her decisions. She has been dedicated to the sale of food and beverages for 2 years, and what she likes about her work is the direct contact that she has with her clients. Her business is very profitable because it is found in a very well traveled location, and she relies on a select clientele that enjoy her good flavors. She does not have any difficulty since she does very well. Because of this she wants to continue growing her business. This is her second loan with MFP. She wants to have a patio built (a space outdoors, covered by a ceiling held up by poles and branches) and furnished adequately to sell her more tranquil dishes and to give a better atmosphere to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a patio for serving her food

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah T. is 33 years old, married and blessed with five children. When it comes to paying her family's bills and providing enough food to eat, Sarah is a very resourceful and hard worker. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey, a local dish made from corn dough (milled from fresh maize grains) which is cooked and then eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She sells kenkey in the morning and afternoon to school children, and as a breakfast dish for local workers. She has many customers, since Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for both breakfast and lunch.

With this loan, she wants to increase the size of her business by buying more supplies such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. If she can expand her business, she will be able to increase her savings and pay for her children’s education. Sarah is a member of the Good Shepherd Trust Group, whose members agree to help each other repay loans. 

Sarah does not sell on the days her group meets, and this photo was taken during a meeting.

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. C., 31, is a rice farmer in Sala Village in Siem Reap Province.  She has been farming since 1993 and currently makes around KHR4000 (US$1) per day. She works growing rice with her husband and this is the main source of income for the family's needs. She cares for three children who are young teenagers attending school. To gain another source of income, C. needs a loan to build a pigpen and to purchase four piglets to raise and sell.

loans.use: to build a pigpen and to purchase four piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedoras.
Cirila es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 3 hijos, Cirila vende mercería como artículos de limpieza, cintas, bastones, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara. Además Cirila tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende bebidas.
Cirila necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cintas, cordones, palos.
Los sueños de Cirila son ayudar a sus hijos para que sean mejores que ella y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Emprendedoras Communal Bank. Cirila has a live-in partner, is 23 years old, and has 3 children. Cirila sells various household goods, such as cleaning supplies, tapes, and canes, as a street vendor in the Santa Clara market. Cirila also has a store in her home where she sells beverages. Cirila needs a loan for 800 soles to invest in the purchase of tapes, laces, and wooden handles. Her dreams are to help her children have a better life than hers and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tapes, laces, and wooden handles

loans.name: Elizabeth Teodora,

texts.es:
A sus treinta y dos años y con una hija de cinco años, Elizabeth maneja un negocio de comida desde hace un par de años. Gracias a su mamá pudo obtener una casa propia para ella y sus hermanas, donde actualmente vive con su familia. Como llevaba alrededor de cinco años vendiendo comida en un puesto ambulante que tenia, cuando obtuvo la propiedad de su casa no dudó en ambientar un espacio para abrir su restaurante.
Por el momento solo vende comida china y caldos a partir de las seis de la tarde. Con la ayuda de su hermana lleva para adelante el negocio con la idea de que un futuro pueda tener el capital suficiente para agrandar el local.
Ella cubre la mayoría de los gastos de su casa, pues su esposo no tiene un trabajo estable y solo aporta económicamente en el hogar por temporadas de trabajo.
 Compra de abarrotes e implementos  para su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, a 31-year-old mother with a 5-year-old daughter, has been running a fast food business for a couple of years. Thanks to her mother, she was able to obtain her own house, where she and her family currently live, for her and her sisters. Because she had been selling fast food for around five years as a street vendor, she did not hesitate in setting up a restaurant in her own home as soon as she got it.

She only sells Chinese food and soup starting at 6pm for now. With her sister’s help, Elizabeth is moving the business forward with the idea that they will one day have enough capital to expand the business space.

She covers most of the household expenses because her husband does not have a steady job, so he is only able to earn income when he is employed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food and supplies for business

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris T. sells fabrics and clothing in Pedu on the Cape Coast. Doris has received a senior-high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader.

Doris has been selling fabrics and clothing since 2002. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase sales of fabrics and other clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward a house she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase sales of fabrics and other clothing

loans.name: Pefa

texts.en: Pefa A. C. has two years of experience in the plantation business and sells to the general public six days per week. Her loan was requested to purchase weed chemicals, bush knives, and filling knives. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (about $333). SPBD loans are Pefa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her third SPBD loan. She is 40 years old and married with 12 children.

loans.use: To purchase weed chemicals, bush knives, and filling knives.

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en: Rajaa is a 40-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Rajaa has owned a snack business for a year. He makes sandwiches. He requested a loan of $2,000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and a machine for his sandwiches. This is the first time that Rajaa has requested a loan. Rajaa is special in his work because he does it well and he is known for his good sandwiches. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty networking. Rajaa decided on starting his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his snack business.

loans.use: Rajaa will use the loan to purchase merchandise and a machine for his sandwiches.

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru:
Барно Файзиева проживает в Истаравшане со своим мужем Физылом.
 Барно торгует на вещевом рынке, она реализует женскую одежду. Стаж ее работы в сфере предпринимательской деятельности 5 лет.Муж Барно привозит товар из Кыргызстана, а сама Барно продает его на вещевом рынке.
 Планирует в ближайшем будущем расширить ассортимент своего товара, для чего и запрашивает сумму в размере 4000 сомони сроком на 2 месяца.
texts.en:
Barno F. lives in Istaravshan with her husband Fizyl. Barno has a business at the clothing market, where she sells women's clothing. She has five years of experience in this line of work. Barno's husband brings in the goods from Kyrgyzstan, and Barno herself sells them at the clothing market. In the near future, she is planning to expand the selection of goods she carries, and to do so is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El microempresario Justo García R. tiene 46 años de edad es acompañado, tiene 6 hijos, no puede leer y escribir, pero administra una pulpería desde hace mas de 6 años, además se dedica a comprar ostiones por canastas (con concha) y las vende por galones lo que le da un buen negocio ya que esta concha es bastante consumida en esta ciudad de Bluefields.

Con estos dos negocios don Justo ha podido mantener su hogar y darles estudios a sus hijos quienes además en los tiempos libres le ayudan con el negocio de las ostiones, este microempresario ya ha sido beneficiado con un préstamo por parte de kiva el cual pago puntualmente y le permitió hacer algunas mejoras en su casa y negocio.

Sin embargo el señor Justo García necesita se le financie para poder tener mas productos en su pulpería y poder comprar mas canastas de ostiones, ya que no cuenta con suficiente recursos para hacer dicha inversión.

Quiere comprar: 100 canastas de Ostiones que le cuestan US1 cada de canasta, 3 quintales de  azúcar que le cuestan US30 cada quintal, 3 frijoles que le cuestan US34 cada quintal, 3 harina que le cuestan US45 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite que le cuestan US30 cada bidón, 12 unidades de café presto que le cuestan US3 cada unidad,5 bolsones de  papel higiénico que le cuestan US12 cada bolsón,  5 cajas de sopa maruchan que le cuestan US5 cada caja,  28 sacos de carbón que le cuestan US2 cada saco y 3 quintales de arroz americano que le cuestan US44 cada quintal.
texts.en:
The mirco businessman Justo García R. is 46. He is in a common law marriage, and he has six children. He cannot read or write, but he has been running his mini market for over six years. Also, he buys baskets of oysters (with the shell) and sells them by the gallon. This is a good business because they consume a lot of oysters here in the city of Bluefields. With these two businesses Justo has been able to support his household and give his children an education. The children help with the oyster business in their free time. This micro businessman has received one loan from Kiva, which he paid back punctually. This allowed him to make some improvements on his house and in his business. Nevertheless, Justo García needs a loan to be able to have more products in his mini market and to be able to buy more baskets of oysters. He does not have sufficient resources to cover those costs now. He wants to buy: 100 baskets of oysters at $1 per basket, 300 pounds of sugar at $30 per 100 pounds, 300 pounds of beans at $34 per 100 pounds, 300 pounds of flour at $45 per 100 pounds, 2 drums of oil at $30 per drum, 12 units of coffee at $3 per unit, 5 packages of toilet paper at $12 per package, 5 cases of Maruchan soup at $5 per case, 28 bags of coal at $2 per bag, and 300 pounds of American rice at $44 per 100 pounds.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oysters, sugar, flour oil, instant coffee, toilet paper, Maruchan soup, coal, and American rice

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria shared that “contentment does not mean getting all you want, but enjoying what you have”.  She is a graduate of secondary education and she formerly taught in public school in their town.  Due to the low salary rate, Candelaria decided to start her own business. She believes she can be more successful and productive.  She even worked abroad for two years in order to earn a bigger amount that she can use as her starting capital.  

She is engaged in selling hog fattening feed in their village.  Due to lack of capital, she now would like to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP17,000 as additional business capital.  She hopes and prays that all her ambitions and dreams will come into reality and become successful. 

Candelaria is still single.  She is continuously supporting her parents as well as her brothers and sisters who need her help.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Zamda

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Zamda S. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 25. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan because her parents died of HIV. 

Zamda has been running a “genge” business since 2002. A genge (grocery store) is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof, where general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish are sold. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, seven days per week. Zamda currently earns about $90 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stock of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business and to open the same business at new location.

Zamda  thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:
Monica L., 36, is a very hard-working lady and a widow with 6 children of whom 5 are still in school. She has owned and managed a restaurant at a nearby market for 13 years, serving local food every day.

Since receiving her first micro-credit loan, Monica has been able to purchase non-perishable items in bulk and thereby save time and money and up her profit. In order to further increase the efficiency of her restaurant and earn still more profit, which will be used to continue educating her children, Monica is requesting a loan to be able to buy more raw foodstuffs that will help bring in more income and increase profitability to be able to continue paying school fees for her children. She is happy that now she can also offer cold drinks to her customers during and after meals.

loans.use: Buying more food stuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia is a 70-year-old widow. She lives together with her extended family, including her daughter's child, her aunt, and her youngest child. Anesia has been the breadwinner of her family since her husband died. Three years ago, she joined ASHI to take a loan to capitalize her business. At her age, she still wants to be productive and help her children, grandchildren and other relatives get out of poverty as much as she can. She started first with a variety store. With her subsequent loans, she was able to raise pigs and sell them after four months. Return on this kind of business is double the amount of her capital. With this profit and another loan, she was able to venture into financing farmers who grow rice. During harvest, the farmers she financed will give her a certain amount of rice depending on their price agreement. Rice paid to her will be sold in her variety store. Profits from these ventures have enabled her to pay her weekly payment to ASHI on time and maintain her business.

Now Anesia wants to take a bigger loan to enhance her business more. Although she is a new businesswoman, she has seen her profit and productivity grow, and so she is seeking more capital to achieve her dreams for her business and family.

Out of her profits, Anesia wishes someday to ensure her family's security by buying a lot and moving with them to a place that isn't always flooding.

loans.use: To finance rice production, start a hog raising business, and sustain a variety store

loans.name: Alexai Odalis

texts.es: Alexai esta solicitando su primer crédito esperando ser beneficiado por  el fondo Kiva, para invertirlo en construcción de una habitación, trabaja como docente en la colonia la Fonseca,  a el le urge construir una habiatacion y así mejorar las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar ya que el interés es bajo por esta razon le gusta trabajar con esta intancia ya que fue recomendado por su tia, este cliente tiene capacidad y voluntad de pago, es un joven trabajador, honesto y muy apreciado en su comunidad, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, apesar que Alexai no tiene hijos le ayuda a su mamà con los gastos del hogar,  su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda digna y bonita, seguir estudiando para asi obtener mejores conocimientos y ser cada dia una persona mejor solicitamos al comites de crédito su aprobación.

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 27 years old and is a divorced young woman with two children. Both of her children are in school in the community where they live. Abena is an achiever and her hard work contributes earnestly to the family.

Abena is a food vendor and sells rice and gravy stew by the roadside in the community where she lives. She has been in the business for the last five years in order to support her children. She takes delivery of goods from Dwinase which is a nearby market where she can have access to stock.

Abena says demand for her food is on the high side but she does not have enough money to meet the demand. She requests the loan to buy rice, spices, vegetables, etc. She would grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, bags of rice, etc.

loans.name: Felicema

texts.en:
Felicema S. B. is now 64 years old and already a widow. Her husband left her with two children: Sheryl now has her own family and is working as a teacher, sometimes helping her mother with some expenses; and Pricela also helping her mother in running their business.

The main source of their income is Felicema’s variety store and also her food preparation business. Although her daughter gives her money from her salary, Felicema wants to pursue her business because this business gives them enough income for their daily expenses.

Now, Felicema will use her loan received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. to buy things that are needed in her two businesses. For her variety store she will buy rice, sugar, soap, canned goods, shampoo, cigarettes and other groceries. For her eatery she will buy different ingredients because she wants to diversify her menu.

Felicema swears that she will do everything to make her business grow, and for her family to experience a sumptuous way of living. She wants to help the family of her children.

loans.use: To finance her variety store and also her food preparation business

loans.name: Theng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Theng O. is the leader of a four-member group. All the group members live in Kdei Ta Hok village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Theng O. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest of whom is too young to work or study. She is a weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more raw materials for weaving. Mrs. Theng O. hopes to increase her income and improve her business. Her husband, Mr. Samreth Sary, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Sar

texts.en: Sar S. is 28 years old and lives with her two young children and her elderly parents in Takeo province. She is a professional weaver who is able to make of US$ 3 every day. Sar S. is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to purchase more silk so she can weave products to sell at the local market.

loans.use: Weaving silk dresses

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: D. Cathérine est née le 20 Avril 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AGBONGBE Célestin, un  employé à l’entreprise Colas au Bénin, Cathérine est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Cathérine a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses enfants. C’est depuis 6 ans que Cathérine vit à Hèdomey à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. En effet, Cathérine vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint, et vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Cathérine n’a jamais été à l’école ; il y a deux ans déjà que Cathérine vend de la friperie au marché de Cococodji et de façon ambulante à Dantokpa marché international du Bénin. Cathérine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa et à Missèbo à Cotonou, un marché de friperie au Bénin. Cathérine a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Pour étendre l’écoulement de sa marchandise sur d’autres marchés du Bénin, Cathérine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Cathérine D. was born on April 20, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Célestin Agbongbe, an employee of Colas in Benin, Cathérine is the mother of two children who are both in school. Cathérine also has another child in her care, in addition to her own two children. Cathérine has lived in Hédomey in Cocotomey, which is not far from Cotonou, for six years. Cathérine lives with her children and her spouse, and helps him take care of the family's expenses. Cathérine never went to school. For two years, Cathérine has sold second-hand clothes at the Cococodji market and as a traveling vendor at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Cathérine gets her stock at Dantokpa and Missèbo in Cotonou, the latter a second-hand clothing market in Benin. Cathérine has already obtained a loan from Alidé and repaid it in full. Cathérine is requesting a second loan through Alidé so she can sell her merchandise in even more markets in Benin.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bundles of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Khourn

texts.en: Khourn M. is 50 years old, married and the mother of four children, three of whom are married and one single. Her husband, Soam Saran is 51 years old and is a fisherman who catches fish along the river. Khourn M. raises pigs as well as cultivates rice to earn a living and earns around $2 each day. Her business is running smoothly and is profitable because she has many years of experience in her business. To make the business more successful with much income, Khourn M. is requesting a loan for extra capital to grow rice or raise pigs. She hopes to use the rest of the loan to buy more tools for her husband’s fishing.

loans.use: To grow rice or raise pigs

loans.name: Capistrana

texts.en: Capistrana S. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 63 years old, is widowed, and has four adult children. Capistrana owns and operates a variety store, selling food and other daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Capistrana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak V. was married a long time ago to Mr. Om York and they are blessed with four young children who are not longer in school. The couple is helped financially by all of their children, from their working in different jobs: two are building workers, one is a garment worker and the remaining one raises poultry from home for a profit. Presently Prak V. and her husband have a piece of land where they plant many kinds of crops to earn a living. Recently they lacked some supplies for their farming business. Prak V. has requested a loan of US$700 to use towards growing crops. (Prak V. was busy at her farm work, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To grow crops.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: L. Juliet is a hardworking businesswoman, 40 years old and married with five children. Four of the children are going to school. She owns a grocery shop that she has been running for over two years. She is using the loan purposely to increase on her stock of grocery items such as salt, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and so forth. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. Nyongesa is a 51 year old married mother with five (5) children. She lives and operates her fish business in Kwirare Busia District.
In 2005 she started her business, after quitting farming that she had been doing since getting married but was generating little income. She buys her stock in Port Victoria on a monthly basis and sells them in Mayanga market.

With future plans of a better education for her children, Agnes would wish to acquire a loan worth Ksh.20000 that will enable her open a retail shop and generate more income for her plans to be achieved.

loans.use: To open a retail shop in a bid to expand her business.

loans.name: Gerardo Faustino

texts.es: Gerardo Faustino C. T.  cuenta con 22 años de edad, Soltero, viven con su familia materna, en la actualidad  se dedica al oficio de Mecánica Automotriz “Reparación de vehículos” se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para  un pequeño préstamo para poder comprar unas herramientas para su trabajo ya que según nos comenta que le hace falta algunas herramientas para poder reparar vehículos, ya que con las herramientas que cuenta le es un poco difícil de trabajar ya que  requiere de más herramientas  para poder ser eficiente en la reparación de vehículos, brindándole esta pequeña ayuda el podrá mejorar su producción, como también mejorará sus ingresos y así  podrá mejorar su  condición de vida.
texts.en:
Gerardo Faustino C. T. is 22 years old. He is single and lives with his family on his mother's side. He currently works as an auto mechanic repairing vehicles. He approached the ASDIR Association for a small loan to buy tools for his work because, as he says, he needs some tools to be able to repair vehicles, since with the tools he has it is a bit difficult to work and he needs more tools to be efficient in repairing vehicles.
