By providing this small help he will be able to improve his production, and also increase his income and in this way have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 24-year-old social lady who is married to a businessman. She has been running a wholesale shop for two years and has two employees to assist her in the business. She also does farming to increase her income and dreams of building rental houses in the future.

Rose has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of maize flour and rice.

loans.use: To add to her stock of maize flour and rice

loans.name: Adeola

texts.en:
Adeola O. sells medicines at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell.

Adeola is 27 years old and is married with a child. Her husband sells motorcycle spare parts at retail prices to support their home. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk to sell

loans.name: Khamisa

texts.en:
Khamisa A. is currently in the business of selling dried fish and charcoal from her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Khamisa is 28 years old and is married to an electrician. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by building a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Daba S. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Depuis le 02 avril 2007 elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDOUCOURA et y a reçu 06 prêts qu'elle rembourse toujours sans problème. Elle est vendeuse de poissons séchés. Elle achète son produit en grande quantité et revend au détail dans son quartier en faisant du porte à porte. Son prêt actuel l'aidera à renforcer et développer son activité de commerce pour gagner plus profits et subvenir à ses besoins personnels et à soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Daba S. is 51 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the NDOUCOURA “Banc Villageois” loan group since 2 April 2007, where she has been granted six previous loans, always repaid without any problems. She sells dried fish. She buys her product wholesale and retails it by going door-to-door in her village. Her current loan will enable her to strengthen and develop her commercial activity and generate more income, to meet her own personal needs and assist her husband in dealing with family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Better develop her activity selling dried fish

loans.name: Nueva Semillita De Santillana Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Semillita D. Santillana son D. L. comunidad D. San José D. Secce, Distrito D. Santillana, Provincia D. Huanta, Las actividades principales D. L. comunidad son L. agricultura y ganadería.
Vicenta es L. presidenta del Banco Comunal, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, es L. primera vez que integra un Banco Comunal, Vicenta tiene una tienda en su casa que se encuentra en L. plaza principal D. L. comunidad, en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, su negocio empezó con L. venta D. golosinas, comida y panes, poco a poco fue implementando su tienda y aun sigue vendiendo comida. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. abarrotes, verduras y golosinas.
Los sueños D. Vicenta son que su negocio se amplíe, sus hijos estén bien en sus estudios, comprar un terreno en L. ciudad D. Huanta y construir su casa en donD. puedan vivir sus hijos para seguir estudios superiores.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "New Little Seed of Santillana" are from the community of San José D. Secce, in the Santillana district in the Huanta province. The principal activities in the community are agriculture and raising livestock. Vicenta is the president of the community bank. She is married and has five children. This is the first time that she has joined a community bank. Vicenta has a store in her house, which is located on the main plaza of the community. She sells groceries in general. Her business began with the sale of candies, food, and bread. Little by little she established her store and still continues selling food. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of groceries, vegetables, and candies. Vicenta's dreams are that her business will grow, her children will do well in their studies, and to buy a plot of land in the city of Huanta and construct a house where her children can live to continue their higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries, vegetables, and candy

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: A. Sylvie est née en 1962 à Tchaourou au Bénin. Depuis vingt six ans environs, Sylvie s'est installée au quartier Dodomey à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Sylvie est une veuve, ayant quatre enfants, dont trois sont encore à sa charge. Tous les enfants de Sylvie sont scolarisés. Sylvie vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges. Sylvie a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins et répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, Sylvie mène comme activité la vente de produits divers (pâtes alimentaires, riz, bidons d'huile végétale, divers conserves, savons, etc.) à Allada. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Sylvie achète ses produits. Sylvie a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Sylvie désire augmenter davantage le volume de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Sylvie sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Sylvie A. was born in 1962 in Tchaourou, Benin. She has been settled for around 26 years in the Dodomey district of Allada in the Atlantique "département" (administrative region). Sylvie is a widow who has four children, three of whom are still in her care. All Sylvie's children are at school. Sylvie lives alone with her children and covers their various expenses. She left school at secondary level. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, Sylvie has an activity selling a variety of products (pasta, rice, containers of vegetable oil, various conserves, soaps, etc.) in Allada. She buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Sylvie has had one loan from ALIDé and repaid it correctly. She would like to increase the volume of her activity and better satisfy her customers; this is the reason she is requesting a second loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of five cartons of pasta and four sacks of rice

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: Santa, de 34 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de San Francisco, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su techo propio. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, no fue un obstáculo para ella, ya que a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, supo sobresalir. Recuerda que empezó con un pequeño negocio de bebidas, y con el pasar del tiempo fue creciendo de a poco, hasta que decidió elevar el segundo piso de su casa con el ahorro que tenía consigo. Hoy tiene otra casa en la localidad de Quimbiri, a la vez está dedicado a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de cacao, en donde lo viene generando buenos ingresos económicos. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en temporada de cosecha recibe la ayuda de sus peones, por otro lado su pareja trabaja como transportista, de esa manera genera otros ingresos para su canasta familiar. Normalmente su producto lo vende a un buen precio, en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Sus planes a futuro es abrir un taller de motos, con la finalidad de que su pareja, quien estudió  mecánica, pueda atender las necesidades de sus clientes. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además se siente fortalecido con su grupo comunal, por la honestidad que existe en  cada uno de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de materiales como: cementos, tierra fina, ladrillos, para el acabado de su casa, ya que tiene planeado construir un hotel, considerando que le será muy rentable este negocio.
texts.en:
Santa, 34, lives with her partner and their two school-aged children. The live in a house they own in San Francisco, a town in the beautiful Cusco countryside. Santa didn't finish elementary school, but that hasn't been an obstacle for her because she works hard and knows how to overcome the barriers in her way. She remembers starting with nothing more than a small store, selling cold drinks, and building it bit by bit until she saved enough to add a second floor to her house. Now she has another house in the town of Quimbiri. She also earns money from farming and, specifically, from growing cocoa, now her main source of income. Normally, she tends the crop herself but she hires laborers to help her during the harvest season. Her partner works as a driver and generates an income that goes to paying the family's bills. Santa's crop usually sells for a good price at her town's local warehouse. For the future, she would like to open a motorcycle repair shop because her partner, who studied to be a mechanic, can run it. This is Santa's eighth MFP loan and she is committed to repaying this one on time, just as she has past loans. She gains strength from the other members of the community bank and values the honesty of the group. With this loan, she will buy various construction materials--cement, sand, bricks--to finish the work on her house because she has plans to operate a hotel, a business that will be very profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a hotel.

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr:
Oumy KOUTYATE est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est aussi tutrice d'un enfant. 

Elle est vendeuse de thioup. Elle s'approvisionne au Mali pour revendre à Ziguinchor. 

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 20 mars 2003. Elle a 14 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter du tissu pour une valeur de 350.000 francs CFA. Elle paye des frais de voyage et de dédouanement pour un montant de 50.000 francs CFA. 

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Oumy KOUTYATE is 44 years old, married and the mother of six children. She is also the guardian of a child. Oumy sells Thioup (a hand-dyed fabric). She gets her stock in Mali to sell at Ziguinchor. She has been a member of the COLOBANE FASS "Banc Villageois” since March 20, 2003 and has received 14 consecutive loans. She has never had any problem with repaying. She is going to buy 350,000 francs CFA worth of fabric with this new loan. Her goal is to contribute financially to the children’s food, health care and school expenses.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Thioup fabric

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 50-year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his two old parents and he takes care of them. He has more than 25 years experience working in car electric repair. His shop is situated in his town and he is known by the neighboring towns also. He ensures the household expenses are paid for sick and aging family members. He was able, over the years, to enlarge his business and create a good base of clients asking for his services. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,000 to purchase new electric tools and supplies instead of the used ones. He’s sure that with the new equipment he will be able to deliver his services faster and take more work. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit partners.kivaorg/partners/115

loans.use: purchase new electric tools and supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Aun Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of fifteen people who live in Pou village, Takeo province. All the members in this village will use their loan for varied purposes to improve their businesses. Mrs. Aun N. is the village bank president, born in 1976 and selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Cham N., are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. Moreover he is a construction worker and he is also a fisherman. 

Mrs. Aun N.'s problem is that her rice field is far away from the irrigation system. So to improve her production, Mrs. Aun N. is asking for a loan to buy a pump. Any remainder of the loan will be used to buy rice seed. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is studying in school while the other is helping her to do farming.

loans.use: To buy a pump

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 28 años, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de sus 2 hijas gemelas, ambas de 5 años, juntas y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan una humilde  morada ubicada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Recuerda como empezó su negocio de comercialización de productos de aceites y  refrigerantes para autos, cuando vendía al por mayor, antes compraba estos productos en grandes bidones y los vendía al por menor a sus habituales clientes. Pero desde hace 4 años vende sus productos al por menor cada y dice que así gana regulares ganancias. Paralelamente a este negocio también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, pues lo realiza con personas conocidas, así asegura que le puedan cumplir con el pago, ya que vende sus productos a crédito. Además le gusta bastante su trabajo porque le permite generarse buenas ganancias que le alcanzan para  brindarles lo mejor a sus hijas; y como es una mujer que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene planeado aumentar la cantidad de mercadería, ya que cuenta con clientes fijos que le compran sus productos. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en aceites y refrigerantes para autos que le hacen falta para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
28 year old Juana lives in a rented house with her two twin daughters, who are 5 years old. They are eager to improve their situation. They live in a humble dwelling located in a very crowded neighborhood to the north of the city. She remembers how she started her business marketing engine oil and coolants for cars, which were sold wholesale. She used to buy these products in large drums and sold them at retail price to regular customers. But, for the past 4 years she has sold individual retail goods and says that in this way she can earn a regular income. At the same time as running this business, she also sells beauty products from a catalog. She sells to people that she knows as the products are sold on credit and she needs to be sure she can always make the payments. She likes her work because it brings in good income and makes it possible for her to give the best to her daughters. As she is a woman who is eager to get ahead, she has plans to increase the amount of merchandise she carries, as she has regular customers who buy her products. This is the first loan she has had from MFP, and she promises to make her repayments punctually. In addition, she does not want to disappoint the people who made the loan possible and are helping her to keep working. Juana plans to use the loan to buy a greater quantity of oils and coolants for cars, as she that she can offer more variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock-up on oil and other products for vehicles.

loans.name: Amina

texts.ru: Набиева Амина проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 49 лет. Замужем, имеет  8 детей. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она в основном берет заказы на даму.  Целью кредита является покупка ткани и бисера.
texts.en:
Amina N. lives in the Hamadoni district. She is 49 years old, married and has 8 children. She has a secondary education. Amina has been involved in sewing national dresses for over 10 years. She primarily takes in the orders at home. The goal of this loan is the purchase of fabric and beads.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farbic and beads

loans.name: Mirzohamid

texts.en:
Born in Kumsangir region in 1959, Mirzohamid now lives with his wife and their four children. Mirzohamid is a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Mirzohamid would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of 1500 USD to buy fertilizer so as to expand his crop. The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and give all his children higher education. Mirzohamid is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams through this loan.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es: Rosenda, de 27 años, es el sostén de su familia; convive con Julián, de 31años, la pareja tiene 3 hijos, Wimbliaw, de 10, Yuritza, de 5 y, Danny, de 2 años de edad; como una gran familia, ellos viven en una casa alquilada en el centro poblado de “Santa Clara”. Todas las mañanas ella, organiza las actividades de la familia. Su esposo Julián, se interna varios días, a trabajar en la mina de su localidad. Por ello Rosenda, distribuye bien sus actividades: durante las mañanas, ella atiende a su pequeña pero abastecida tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su localidad; y por las tardes se dirige a sus terrenos de cultivos, donde cuida sus sembríos de papa y arveja. Lleva 13 años dedicándose a la agricultura, en todo este tiempo pudo adquirir conocimiento y habilidad para sobrevivir de ello; “nunca dejare de cultivar”, afirma. Más adelante ella alquilará más terrenos de cultivo para sembrar más variedades de papa, y así poder vender en diferentes lugares del país y no solo 3 veces al año. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y está muy contenta porqué ahora ya puede ahorrar y planear nuevos objetivos. Con el crédito que adquirirá, está pensando invertir en el arriendo de terrenos de cultivo y el pago del personal que trabajará en su nuevo proyecto; en el que piensa sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Rosenda, age 27, provides support for her family. She lives with her partner Julián, age 31, and has three children: Wimbliaw who is 10, Yuritza who is 5, and Danny who is 2 years old. Her family is large and they live in a rented house in the central village of Santa Clara. Every morning she organizes her family’s activities. Her husband Julián is away several days at his job at the local mine. For this reason, Rosenda manages her time well among her activities. In the mornings, she attends to her small but well-stocked grocery store where she sells basic necessities to the local villagers. In the afternoons, she looks after her farmland on which she grows potatoes and peas. Rosenda has been farming for 13 years and has acquired the knowledge and skills needed to survive in this type of work. “I’ve never stopped farming,” says Rosenda. Later on, she wants to rent more farmland so that she can grow more varieties of potatoes and be able to sell them in other parts of the country more often than just three times a year.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Rosenda is very pleased because she can now save and set new goals. With the loan she acquired, she plans to invest in rented farmland and pay the workers who will carry out her new project in which she plans to plant more potatoes.

loans.use: Rent additional farmland and pay workers for growing more potatoes

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira A. lives in Sokuluk village and is the single mother of two girls. Elmira works as a hairdresser, but her salary is low and does not cover all of her family expenses. Therefore, in 2005, Elmira started a business to create an additional means of income. She converted one of the rooms in her flat into a small shop and started selling groceries. 

Elmira is requesting a loan of 60,000 KGS to use to expand the assortment of goods she offers for sale. With the revenue from the loan she plans to provide a good education for her children.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of goods for sale

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector La Clake, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Reque, una zona comercial situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas relacionadas con la crianza y venta de animales. Por un lado tiene un grupo de vacas de las cuales vende la leche que producen a sus vecinos, adicionalmente cría aves de corral y ovejas para comercializarlas a los negociantes de la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Rosa desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda las cuales le permitirán vivir de mejor modo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de progresar y seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 26 year old mother who lives with her spouse and their two children in the sector La Clake, a rural zone principally dedicated to agriculture.  It is located in the Reque district, a commercial zone situated 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
She works in agriculture, specifically in raising and selling animals.  She has a group of cows and she sells the milk that they produce to her neighbors.  Also, she raises domesticated birds for meat and eggs in order to sell them to the local businesses.  With the income that she gets from these activities, she helps her husband with the economic support of the family.
Rosa wants to make certain improvements in her house, which would permit them to live in a better manner.  For this reason she finds it appropriate to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles, with which she would achieve her goal.  She is a woman with a great drive to improve and continue helping her family.

loans.use: To make improvements to Rosa's home

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 31 years old and a resident Kitale Town in Western Kenya. He has been doing mixed farming for four years, producing and selling eggs and milk to the local market. He is married with three children aged between the ages of six and two years.

He has requested for this loan amounting to 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. His first loan was in the amount of 20,000 KES. He wants to add more poultry to his farm and believes this will earn enough income to educate his children. He is also focusing on improving his dairy stock to four cows for better production. 

He says poultry diseases are costly to treat and remains his worst challenge. He would urge Juhudi to diversify their products.

loans.use: Purchase of  poultry

loans.name: Milman

texts.en:
Milman B., from Layawan, Oroq.City, is 32 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Milman owns and operates a general store selling a variety of daily-use products to local community members. Engaged in his business for over two years, he earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Milman joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC, he is requesting a second loan of 50000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. Milman plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his store.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Willa

texts.en:
Willa G. is from the town of Surallah. She is 55 years old. Willa is married and has four children, aged 23, 20, 17 and 13. To make a living, Willa raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Willa also has a backyard piggery, where she fattens pigs.

Willa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Willa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Willa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy farm inputs and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ground nuts for her store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married women. She is from Lebanon and lives with her husband and three school-aged children. She has been working as a female hairdresser and beauty specialist for 17 years. In 2005, she decided to begin working from her own home. She helps her husband who works as an agent in a local company with the family income.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase hair removal and tattoo machines so that she can enlarge her business and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase hair removal and tattoo machines

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Soutoura sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente d’oignon, de savon de fabrication locale (kabakourouni), de tubercules (pomme de terre et igname) et des fruits (banane, mangue et orange).
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont adhéré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2 ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata  K. est connue dans le quartier pour sa vente de savon local. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 sacs de savon ‘’kabakourouni’’ au grand marché de Ségou avec les forains de Sikasso. La revente se fait en détail au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, en ambulant et au marché Château à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame Fatoumata  K. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge la scolarisation de leurs enfants. 
Elle a pour ambition d’augmenter la taille de son petit commerce dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
 NB :   Korotimi C.  est absente de la photo pour cause de décès dans leur famille.
texts.en:
The seven women in the Soutoura group are all married in monogamous families and are on average 34 years old with four children. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and got acquainted through ties of marriage, neighborhood and their revenue-generating activities at the Segou Castle Market. 

Group members buy and sell onions, locally-made soap (kabakourouni), tubers (potatoes and yams) and fruit (bananas, mangoes and oranges). In order to increase their working capital group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second loan cycle.

Ms. Fatoumata Keita is known in the neighborhood as a vendor of local soap. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 bags of kabakourouni soap at the Segou general market from Sikasso fairground vendors. Retail sales are for cash or credit through home delivery, as itinerant vendors or at the Castle Market, to both men and women customers. 

Ms. Fatoumata Keita hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA to be reinvested in the business and to take care of her children's schooling. Her aim is to increase the size of her small business in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

Note: Korotimi C. is absent from the picture due to death in her family.

loans.use: Buy local soap (kabakourouni)

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
Jimmy, de 32 años, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus hermanos menores; juntos buscan progresar cada día.

Desde muy joven este trabajador hombre se dedica a la reparación de equipos electrónicos (televisores, computadoras, refrigeradoras, entre otros)  en su taller que esta ubicado en su vivienda. Su pasión por este oficio empezó cuando era pequeño pues observaba como sus tíos realizaban esta labor, y así mirando aprendió todas las técnicas necesarias. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues empieza desde muy temprano y se prolonga hasta la noche, de lunes a viernes,  además el tiempo le ha permitido captar cantidad de clientes que lo buscan por la calidad y confianza del trabajo que desempeña. También paralelamente a esta labor, desde hace cuatro años,  durante los fines de semana se desempeña como sonidista para una empresa que presta el servicio de sonidos y luces, por lo que no tiene descanso, pero tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar su propia empresa de servicio de sonido. 

Jimmy tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales (lentes ópticos, zoom, celulares, entre otros) que necesita para mejorar su trabajo, pues quiere comprar en cantidad para no ir tantas veces a la ciudad donde los venden pues esta algo alejada.

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 32 years old and lives in his parents' home with his parents and his younger siblings.  Together they all seek to make progress every day.

Since he was very young, this hard-working man has been repairing electronic equipment (television sets, computers, refrigerators, etc.) in his workshop which is located in his home.  His passion for this trade started when he was small as he used to watch his uncles carrying out this work.  He learned all the skills he needed from watching them.  Jimmy really enjoys his work.  He starts work very early in the morning and keeps going until evening, from Monday to Friday.  Over time, he has attracted a large number of customers who seek him out for the quality of his work and the confidence that they have in his work.  In addition to this work, for four years he has also worked as a sound engineer for a company that provides sound and light services.  He does not rest.  However, he has a lot of plans for the future such as setting up his own company offering sound services.

Jimmy plans to invest the money he is requesting in purchasing materials (optical lenses, zoom lenses, cell phones, etc.) that he needs to improve his business since he would like to buy in bulk so that he doesn't have to travel to the city so often to buy his products - it is quite a long way.

This is the first loan that Jimmy has had with MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time since he doesn't want to let down the people who have made this money possible as it will allow him to continue working in search of progress.

loans.use: To buy optical lenses, zoom lenses, cell phones, etc.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El señor Sergio B. S. tiene 33 años de edad y vive desde hace varios años en la comunidad de Chocloca casa  que es de  propiedad de su suegra. Sergio es padre de 2 hijos, a quienes cuida y apoya en sus estudios junto con su esposa Gilda Janeth Añizares quien participa de la presente solicitud de crédito ahora el tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su esposa e  hijos. Sergio se dedica desde hace mas de 8 años a trabajar en una empresa como perforista de rocas para la construcción de canales de riego, la empresa en la que trabaja se denomina "Soinbol S.R.L."  Sergio quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su esposa e hijos, pero él nos cuenta que quiere comprarse una máquina perforadora para poder trabajar de una manera más efectiva como él ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el crédito será destinado para la compra de dicha máquina que es necesaria para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Sergio nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Sergio B. S. is 33-years-old and has lived in the Chocloca community for many years in a house that his mother-in-law owns.  Sergio is the father of two children who he takes care of and supports in their studies along with his wife Gilda Janeth Añizares who is participating in the current loan request.  Now he has to work to be able to get ahead along with his wife and children.  Sergio has worked for more than eight years in a business as a rock driller for the construction of irrigation canals.  The business where he works is called Soinbol S.R.L.  Sergio would like to have a better income so that he can get ahead along with his wife and children, but he tells us that he wants to buy a drilling machine in order to work more effectively as now he has experience in the area.  The loan will be used to buy this machine that is necessary to do this work so that in this way he can increase his income.
Sergio tells us that he wants to improve his quality of life, he says that the next loan he requests will be to improve the house where he lives.

loans.use: to buy work tools for well drilling.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Doña Adela, es una señora dedicada a vender refrescos y gaseosas, tiene 63 años D. edad, vive en compañía D. su esposo don Lucio C. y sus nietos, residen en San Francisco Gotera departamento D. Morazán.
Su negocio es la venta D. refrescos y gaseosas en su vivienda, por el momento quiere invertir en el negocio que posee su hija que es la venta D. comida en el mercado municipal, como una ayuda para que pueda crecer con el negocio. 
Con dicha inversión estará mejorando el negocio y ofrecerá mayor variedad D. productos a los clientes, dándole a su hija una mayor rentabilidad; Su objetivo es ayudar a sus nietos para que continúen estudiando, así también fortalecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Adela is a lady who sells soft drinks and soda.  She is 63 years old and lives with her husband, Lucio C., and her grandchildren in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.

Adela's business is selling soft drinks and soda from her home.  On this occasion, she would like to invest in her daughter's business which is selling meals in the town market.  She would like to do this to help her so that she can grow in her business.

This investment will help her daughter to improve her business and be able to offer a wider variety of products to her customers.  This will increase the profitability of her daughter's business.  Adela's goal is to help her grandchildren so that they can continue studying and also to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (for her daughter's business)

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 23 años convive desde hace 4 años con Leonidas. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Salvador y Silvano; a los que cuidan con mucho amor y cariño en una casa alquilada ubicada en el caserío de Huanchan. El trabajo arduo y sacrificado de la agricultura, es su principal actividad económica. Desde hace 4 años viene sembrando en terrenos alquilados, como también con socias que comparten los gastos de la siembra. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, maíz y arveja. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver crecer sus sembríos, pues trabaja arduamente para poder mantener sus cultivos sanos y saludables; y ello lo demuestra con la buena venta de sus sembríos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Asimismo tiene una vaca a la que extrae la leche y elabora queso y tres toros, para el arado de la tierra, ganando así un dinero extra. “Vendo 15 quesos a la semana, obteniendo S/. 2 soles de ganancia por cada venta”, menciona. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Unión huanchan”, y este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente realizada pues recibe el apoyo constante de sus compañeros. Lucila, invertirá el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá en sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Lucila is 23 years old and has lived with her partner, Leonidas, for four years.  They have two children, Salvador and Silvano, whom they love and care for in a rented house in the Huanchan rural area.  The arduous and demanding work of agriculture is her main source of income.  For four years she has been growing crops on rented farmland and sharing planting costs with business partners.  Her main crops are potatoes, corn and peas.

What she enjoys most about her work is seeing the crops grow since she works hard to keep them in good condition in a healthy environment.  This can be seen by the successful sales her crops have in the central market of the city of Tarma.  She also has a dairy cow, and makes cheese, and three oxen to plough the earth, so she can make a little extra money.  

"I sell 15 cheeses a week, and make S/. 2 (PEN) of profit on each sale.", she says.  She belongs to the "Unión Huanchan" communal bank and this is her fourth loan through MFP, where she feels good about the constant support she receives from her colleagues.  Lucila plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer to put on her potato crop.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz’s husband is a butcher by profession. He sells good quality meat and good in weight to his customers and that’s why he has a good number of people who come to him to buy meat. 

Mumtaz is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also sews clothes to share the financial burden with her husband.  Her earning allows her to pay the utilities. She has given birth to five children but no one is able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business by purchasing chickens in larger quantity. This will help him fill larger orders on time and earn good income.  He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Mumtaz is confident that an investment will help  him improve his business further and her family will be able to live a better financial life in a result. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has  paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

She belongs to a small city called Arifwala which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and is known for its dairy industry. Her house contains 3 rooms where she has been living with her family for the past 26 years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Mumtaz.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell for meat.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa se dedica a la venta de leña, refrescos y queso. Tiene 52 años ella ha luchado toda su vida por proporcionarle a sus hijos la educación, vestimenta y alimento diario. Inicio este negocio cuando se esposo se retiro de trabajar, juntos dijeron establecer este negocio en su vivienda. Esta no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia con los financiamientos pues le han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia, es por eso que recurre a un nuevo crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de azúcar, bolsas, pajillas, frutas, leña y queso.
texts.en: Tomasa makes her living selling firewood, sodas and cheese.  She is 52 years od and has fought her whole life to provide her children with education, clothing and food every day.  Tomasa started this business when her husband stopped working.  Together, they decided to establish this business in their home.  This is not Tomasa's first experience with financing.  In the past it has helped her to keep her family going.  That is why she turned to a new loan; to invest in the purchase of sugar, bags, straws, fruit, firewood and cheese.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, bags, straws, fruit, firewood and cheese.

loans.name: Rhyjil

texts.en:
Rhyjil, 27, is a rice farmer from the town of Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur. She has been into this business for 9 years.

The loan that she took from Community Economic Ventures Inc. will help her pay the farm inputs such as seed and labor. Aside from financing a farm, she plans to buy feed for her pigs.

Rhyjil has two children. Her eldest child is 9 years old while her youngest child is only 4. Her dream in the future is to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pay for labor and buy pig feeds

loans.name: Kesue

texts.en:
Kesue is 27 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children. He grows seasonal crops on his land, working on the crops until it is time to harvest them. 

In addition, for extra income he raises goats. This is his third loan from KADET LTD. He will buy seeds and fertilizers for his land with this loan.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to invest in another business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en:
Roudayna, a 29-year-old entrepreneur, is married and has 3 children. She has owned a grocery store for 2 years. Her customers include friends and other community members. Roudayna is very passionate about her work and believes she can't live without it because it helps a lot with her family's income and in covering their expenses.

Roudayna is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, for the first time, in order to expand her business range by introducing new fruits and vegetables in her store and by providing better quality products with competitive prices. Roudayna hopes to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: To add new summer vegetables and fruits to her store

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin and her husband, married since 1976 and the parents of four sons and three daughters, are farmers. They live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sin is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting because she does not have her own transportation.

Photo: Sin and her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga, tiene la edad de 49 años, está casada, vive con su hijo y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la siembra de su café. Ella quiere mejorar la plantación de su cafetal y repoblar la parte más escasa de café. Ella quiere con este obtener de su cafetal mejores producciones y así generar mayores ganancias para su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Dominga is 49-years-old.  She is married and lives with her son and her husband who are her top priority.  She plans to use the loan to buy agricultural additives for growing coffee.  She wants to improve her coffee plantation and replant the part that has fewer coffee plants.  She wants to do this to obtain better production from her coffee plantation and thus generate greater profits for her family’s well-being.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She hasn’t taken out any earlier loans with state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with great ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee.

loans.name: Rama Krichna

texts.fr:
Cliente de 30 ans, mariée avec 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 2 et 12 ans. A l'obtention de son Brevet d'études Technique, n'ayant pas trouve du boulot elle ouvre un restaurant en début 2011, ou elle vend des plats de poissons d'eau douce, de poisson sale, de bouillon de viande et poissons grilles, du poulet. Elle vend en moyenne 60.000 a 80.000 fr par jour.

Des qu'elle va recevoir son prêt elle va faire des stocks et s'approvisionner en produits qu'elle n'arrive pas a acheter a cause des moyens, tel que cartons de queue de bœuf, cartons de morue, bidon de 25l d'huile, de la boisson, aménager son restaurant et ajouter quelques couverts. 

A l'avenir avec ses bénéfices, elle compte épargner et ouvrir un restaurant moderne afin de bien subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This customer is 30 years old, married, and has three children aged two to twelve. As she could not find a job after completing her Certificate in Technical Studies, she opened a restaurant in early 2011, where she sells dishes of freshwater fish, salted fish, meat broth, grilled fish and chicken. Her daily sales average 60,000 to 80,000 XAF.

As soon as she obtains her loan, she will build up her stock by procuring products she cannot buy for lack of funds such as boxes of oxtail and cod, 25-liter jugs of vegetable oil and beverages. She will also fix up her restaurant and add a few seats.

In the future, she wants to save her profits to open a modern restaurant in order to provide properly for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of oxtail, freshwater fish and salted fish.

loans.name: 24 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Loan is the leader of a three-member group, the 24 Điện Biên Solidarity Group. She is 40 years old and is married with one child. Loan lives with her family in in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past five years, Loan has operated a food stall where she sells pork pies and fermented pork rolls. Her main business challenge is the lack of capital. In 2009, Loan joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and she has successfully repaid one previous loan. 

Loan is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls. With her profits, she hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, maintain a successful business, and be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, gladiola bulbs and corn.

loans.name: Herlentsetseg

texts.en: Herlentsetseg is 53 years old and lives in a house in the Hentii province of Mongolia.  Her children are living seperately.  She started her business in 1991 by sewing clothes and costumes from her home.  Now she rents a building to run her business and this is her fifth year renting the same building.  Mostly she makes Mongolian traditional costumes and uniforms.  She has many years of business and work experience.  Her traditional costumes are well recognized in the town.  She is a hard-working, diligent woman who says, "I have been making clothes for all my life.  This is the only thing I can do.  Also my business brings sufficient income for me.  In the future, I plan to make European clothes."  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase cloth and materials to make uniforms.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and materials to make uniforms.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 41-year-old married man living in Trinidad, Bohol.

Alexander runs a motorcycle taxi business and has had this business for five years. This business earns 4000 PHP per month.

Alexander is asking for a loan to repair his motorcycle. This will help him continue earning from his business. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Floridalma Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Floridalma Rosa es casada, tiene 50 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos, 1 de los cuales aun estudia, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa de diferentes clases y tamaños, inició este trabajo vendiendo de casa en casa y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia en vender en un puesto de venta.

solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para la compra de mercadería, consistente en ropa para bebés, espera en el futuro que su negocio crezca y obtenga mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Floridalma Rosa is 50 years old, married and was unable to get an education.  She has eight children, one of which is in school, and her business is selling different types and sizes of clothing.  Although she began her business selling door to door, she has been working from her shop for seven years.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, consisting of infant clothing.  Her goal is to grow the business and improve her income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Pedro Marcos

texts.es:
Pedro es socio del Banco Comunal Solidaridad, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 6 años.
Pedro tiene un Taller de Mecánica y es Docente de Mecánica en un Instituto, siempre tuvo el negocio de la Mecánica, recuerda que antes tenia pocas maquinarias y ahora con la ayuda de Finca pudo obtener mas maquinarias, agradece por las capacitaciones recibidas y la ayuda que ha recibido con los préstamos, las capacitaciones ayudaron a aperturar correctamente su negocio y la mejora del mismo, los ahorros son de mucha importancia para él porque le ayudan a poder fijarse metas y poder cumplirlas. Ahora con el préstamo techara su Taller, y la gran meta que tiene  es poder adquirir una Torno Mecánico.
texts.en:
Pedro is a member of the Solidaridad communal bank. He is 53 years old and has 3 children. He has been a member of FINCA Peru for 6 years. 
Pedro has a mechanics workshop and is a mechanics instructor in an institute. He has always had the mechanics business. He recalls that he had little equipment and now with Finca's help he was able to buy more equipment. He is grateful for the trainings he has received and the help he has received through the loans. The trainings helped him open his workshop correctly and improve it. The savings are very important to him because they have helped him to set goals and meet them. Now, with the loan, he will put a roof on his workshop and his biggest goal is to acquire a mechanical drill.

loans.use: to put a roof on his workshop.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is married and has 4 children. She has been through junior high school. Nana bags corn dough in transparent bags to sell. She also sells charcoal at Takoradi, which she has done for 3 years. Her husband is a mason. The income from her sales is added to that of her husband to take care of their home. 

Her loan will be used to buy maize to make corn dough and cassava dough to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to make corn dough and cassava dough to sell.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old, single and lives with four family members, two of whom work.

Salman is a tailor. In 2009 he decided to open his own workshop for making, repairing, or altering clothing such as suits, coats and trousers for women and men. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of the needs of local customers. He has a good reputation and is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2800 in order to pay the annual rent and to make display cases. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to make display cases.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в районе Джикул. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. У них пятеро детей. Сам Бахтиёр занимается выращиванием овощей для продажи. Кроме того он сажает фруктовые деревья. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyor lives in the Jilikul region. He's married and has five children. His wife takes care of the household, while Bakhtiyor makes a living by growing vegetables for sale. He also tends to an orchard.
He's asking for a loan in order to buy some mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Berdimurat

texts.en: Berdimurat is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and their two sons are school students. He started his business in 2006 by purchasing truck to do transport. Now that the construction business is booming in town, he wants to buy another truck. He is a sharp and diligent man who says, "This summer, my income was doubled and this is just a start. I wish to increase more, so my family will live happily, finally." He is short the amount of 3,000,000 MNT to buy a truck.

loans.use: To buy another truck.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 37 años de edad es casado tiene 7 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 18, 13, 10, 8, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Juan se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales, construcción, tiene sembríos de papas, trigo, maíz, arveja, siembra en terrenos de Arriendo, tiene 2 cabezas de ganado.
Las compra y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para destinarlo para la siembra de maíz (compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, mano de obra).
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la situación económica de la familia. El sueño es poder comprar terreno  y construir una vivienda, dar el estudio a los hijos.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta  son las plagas y enfermedades  en los cultivos y problemas de salud.
En los tiempos libres le gusta el deporte, salir de paseo con la familia fiestas del carnaval y San Pedro.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 37 years old, married and has 7 children.  He lives with his wife and his children ages 18, 13, 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.

He is a member of VRC VENTANAL, which is found in the community of Guantuncoto, in the parish of Julio Moreno in Cantón Guaranda, at a distance of 30 minutes from the office.  The inhabitants of the community work at different trades such as: agriculture, business, construction, and raising cattle, pigs, chickens, and sheep,. 

Juan works in agriculture, raising animals, and construction.  He has sown potatoes, wheat, corn, and green peas, planting in the fields of Arriendo. He has 2 head of cattle.

He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda.  He requests the loan to use for the planting of corn (purchase of fertilizers, seeds, labor). 

With the help of the loan, he will be able to improve the financial situation of his family.  His dream is to be able to purchase land and build a home and to provide education to his children.  The challenges that he faces are damages and diseases in the crops and health problems.

In his free time, he enjoys sports, and spending time with his family in the festivals of the carnival and San Pedro..

loans.use: to put it to use for the planting of corn (purchase of fertilizers, seeds, labor)

loans.name: Aljane

texts.en:
Aljane is married and has one child. She is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Aljane operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years and every month she earns PHP 15,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to repair her vehicle to provide better service.

Aljane has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Aljane hopes to improve and expand her business and to earn twice as much income from her business.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Eyra De La Soledad

texts.es: Eyra de la Soledad ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, y ha sido una clienta responsable y mantiene su record crediticio limpio, su actividad continua siendo la crianza de cerdos y gallinas en cual nos expresa Eyra que gracias al financiamiento que le brindaron a aumentado su clientela con los cerdos y la gallina que compro con el financiamiento. Eyra actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir más en el negocio en la compra de cerdos y gallinas y el alimento de los animales.
texts.en: Eyra de la Soledad is a long-time Fundacion Leon 2000 customer and a responsible borrower with a good record of repaying her loans.  She makes a living raising and selling pigs and chickens.  She tells us that she used past loans to buy more pigs and chickens and the investment helped her to find new customers.  Eyra is applying for a new loan, part of which she will use to buy more animals and the rest to buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animals for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and she is married with 3 children.  

She has had a dairy farming business which she has run for 17 years now and she enjoys it. 

Martha has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will be using to purchase quality dairy feeds so as to boost milk production of her cows.

With the anticipated profits, Martha will be able to pay her children's school fees.

Her hopes and dreams are to excel in business as her children excel in life through education.

loans.use: to purchase quality dairy feeds so as to boost milk production of her cows

loans.name: Amalia Lizbeth

texts.es: Doña Amalia se dedica a la producción y comercialización de frijoles, cultivo en el cual tiene gran experiencia. Con un préstamo de $2,100 puede comprar insumos agrícolas, semilla y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento de dicha plantación, actividades necesarias para el buen crecimiento y desarrollo de sus plantas. De esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor producto e incrementar las ventas de su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y semilla para cultivo de frijol.

loans.name: Marie Adoudé

texts.en:
Mrs. Marie Adoudé A. is a woman of about 45. She resells plastic bags and packaging. She has been in this business for 15 years with the financial resources she could get, for she has no real capital. She received an initial credit of $300 that she was able to manage very well and repay without any difficulties. She later got and easily paid back two (2) other credits, showing how honest and trustworthy she is. As the year ends, she needs a credit of $750 that will help buy a supply of plastic bags and packaging. The credit will stabilize her business, and the profit she earns will allow her to meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Marie Adoudé est une femme âgée de 45 ans environ. Elle est revendeuse de sachets plastiques et d’emballage. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans avec ses moyens financiers de bord car elle n’a pas un véritable fonds de commerce. Elle a bénéficié d’un crédit de $ 300 qu’elle a su bien gérer et rembourser sans incident et en a bénéficié deux (02) autres parfaitement remboursés également. Ce qui fait d’elle une femme honnête et de confiance. A cette période de fin d’année, elle a besoin d’un crédit de $750 qui servira à l’approvisionnement des sachets plastiques et d’emballages. Ce crédit stabilisera son activité et les revenus tirés lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: to buy a supply of plastic bags

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is in need of a $700 loan to expand her business to include a restaurant. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She knows about the TEACH Lending program and can use record-keeping techniques effectively.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Juana Hirma

texts.en:
Hirma is 41 years old, has two children, and her husband works as a night watchman. She has a small business selling sweets and cookies at a primary school by the name of “Brother Victor María Flores”, located in her neighborhood. She sells during the children’s recess. Her objective is to expand her business by selling breakfast to the children and to the personnel who work at the school. She is part of the “Ecatepec Group 2”.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

HIRMA TIENE 41 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA COMO CUIDADOR NOCTURNO Y ELLA TIENE UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO DE DULCES Y GALLETAS EN UNA ESCUELA PRIMARIA "FRAY VICTOR MARIA FLORES" UBICADA EN SU LOCALIDAD, ELLA VENDE DURANTE EL RECREO DE LOS NIÑOS. TIENE COMO OBJETIVO AMPLIAR EL NEGOCIO VENDIENDO DESAYUNOS PARA LOS NIÑOS Y AL PERSONAL QUE LABORA EN LA INSTITUCION. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ECATEPEC 2.

loans.use: To expand business by beginning to sell breakfasts

loans.name: Emiliana Lucinda

texts.en: Emiliana is a single mother of seven. She works as a local vendor selling golosinas and snacks, in the streets of Juliaca and at a local market, Tupac Amaru. Emiliana has worked as a street vendor for as long as she can remember. As a young child Emiliana often helped out her mother who also sold golosinas. At the moment she works by herself and often travels to Arequipa, five hours away, to purchase her goods. She hopes that with an increased loan she will be able to purchase a greater variety of snacks, including those which are a little bit more expensive but yield a higher profit.

loans.use: Expand variety of snacks.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a 35 year old male. Currently he lives by himself in a small house that he owns. He has a workshop (wood kiosk) located on Carrasco avenue, here he does bicycle repairs and he also sells replacements. Juan has been working on this business for about 8 years, and now he has a solid client base because of his hard work, and his excellent customer service. He has 10 months of experience as a locksmith, he works on this 5 days a week in his home workshop, and the rest if the time he works at the bicycle shop. He is asking for a loan to increase his capital so he can buy a piece of land that is worth $1,500 USD, he has $1,000 saved from his hard work. This is the second credit with the institution and he has demonstrated to be a responsible and punctual person in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan es un señor de 35 años que vive sólo, actualmente vive en una casa pequeña propia, su taller (kiosco de madera) se encuentra ubicado sobre la avenida Carrasco, ahí se dedica a la reparación y venta de repuestos de bicicletas. Juan trabaja en este rubro aproximadamente 8 años, tiempo en el cuál logró consolidar a su clientela por su buen trabajo, cumplimiento y sobre todo su excelente trato. En cuanto a los trabajos de cerrajería cuenta con 10 meses de experiencia, mismos que los realiza 5 días a la semana en su taller que se encuentra instalado en su casa, los dos días restantes de la semana trabaja en el taller de las bicicletas. Con la presente solicitud quiere incrementar su capital para comprar un terreno que vale $us. 1,500.-, el logró juntar $us. 1,000.- por medio de su esfuerzo y trabajo. Este es su segundo crédito con la institución, en este tiempo demostró ser una persona puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Incremento Capital para Compra Terreno

loans.name: Sundi

texts.en:
SUNDI, aged 21, works with her brother, aged 27, to run a movie hall, where viewers pay about 10 cents to watch a movie. Sundi had borrowed a previous loan of $200 about 6 months ago to purchase the TV set. Every day, they play 7 movies (when the electricity is stable) and have around 120 customers. This business makes around $11 a day.

Sundi and her brother began this business 6 months ago after realizing that they needed to find a stable source of income. Living alone, along with Sundi’s 2-year-old girl, they explained that they came up with the idea of borrowing a loan and starting this business because they didn’t have jobs and were going through a rough time financially. As a result of their ambition, their business has been successful and Sundi was able to pay back the first loan on time. Using the profits from the movie hall and from a new loan, they hope to expand their business ventures to include 2 pool tables. A pool table costs $960, and they plan to charge players about 20 cents per game.

Sundi belongs to the group Dhahabu (Swahili for “gold”), which consists of 36 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To expand business with pool tables

loans.name: Muidinkhuja

texts.en: Muidinkhuja S. lives in Khujand. He applied first to MicroInvest in 2007, but he already is the permanent client of MicroInvest because he trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. He has a business in shoes sales. Working in Panjshanbe Bazaar, M. S. meets hard competitors--that is why he wants to widen the existing assortment of winter children's wear. He has the business experience of 5 years of selling. Now he requires a loan to develop and widen the new models of the winter child wear and import new styles.

loans.use: To develop and widen the existing business

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en: My name is Kaneez F., and I am a widow and a mother of nine: six boys and three daughters. I live with my family in a small town called Borewala in Pakistan. None of my kids could attend school, due to our impoverished condition that we had to face after my husband’s death. I need a loan for my son to expand his barber shop. Last year, I received a loan for his barber shop, and with its profits I bought a television for my house. My group members are: Rani T., who requires a loan for her bangles and grocery store; Hasmat B., who will buy a goat with the loan; Shahnaz B., who requires a loan for her poultry farm; and Parween R. needs a loan for her husband’s restaurant.

loans.use: Expand barber shop

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en: Rihab, 37 years old, works and lives in Aley. Rihab is a very talented artist who does embroidery and crochet work. Rihab is trying her best to sustain and develop her business, and therefore, requires a loan to buy materiA. for her business.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S., 37, sells fish at a market and typically earns an average of $5 per day of income. Her husband works at a construction site and also earns around $4 each day. Sin S. has six children. One of them is employed by a private company and the rest of them are students. She would like to use this loan to buy more fish to increase her inventory. Another part of the loan will be used to buy more construction tools for her husband, and to repair part of her house. This loan will change her family’s life and enable her to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish and construction tools, and to repair part of her house

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: When visiting Patience B.’s business you will learn that her freezer used in selling drinks and sachet water is located in her parlor. According to Patience, good customer relationships are needed for customers to patronize a business and she has been able to achieve this because she is an extrovert. She lives in Okoko Lagos State Nigeria and at 28 years of age she has 3 children. She acquired the skill for this business in 6 months. Patience has been in her business since 1997 and requests a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more drinks and sachets of water for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale.

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.es:
Ines, Diana, and Marina are members to the Victoria Community Bank.

Ines is a single mom, is 35 years old and has 3 children. Ines sells cheese that she brings from the Alpachaca community, selling her products from store to store. Ines also cleans houses and provides laundry services. With the loan she will obtain Ines will purchase a cart to sell a chicken dish called salchipollo.

Diana lives with her common law spouse, is 22 years old and she is pregnant with their first child. She sells fish in the fish market in the city of Ayacucho, bringing in her products from Lima.

Marina is married, she is 42 years old and has 2 children. Marina sells prepared foods from her home, and she also has a small grocery store.

Ines, Diana and Marina need loans in the amount of 900 soles, 750 soles, and 1000 soles, monies that will be invested in the purchase of fish, lentils, rice, milk, detergents, and a cart.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Ines, Diana y Marina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Victoria.

Ines es madre soltera, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Ines vende quesos que trae de la comunidad de Alpachaca, sus productos lo vende ambulatoriamente a tiendas, además Ines hace limpieza y lava ropa ajena. Ines con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar una carreta para vender salchipollo.

Por otro lado Diana es conviviente, tiene 22 años y esta embarazada de su primer hijo, Diana vende pescado en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus productos lo adquiere de la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Marina es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Marina vende comida en su casa, además tiene una tienda de abarrotes.

Ines, Diana y Marina necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescados, lenteja, arroz, leche, detergente y una carreta.

Los sueños de Inés, Diana y Marina son tener un trabajo seguro, sus hijos estudien, tener una tienda de abarrotes, construir su casa.

loans.use: Ines, Diana and Marina request a loan in the amounts of 900 soles, 750 soles, and 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of  fish, lentils, rice, milk, detergent, and a cart.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos P. is a gentleman whose business is carpentry. He has been dedicated to this work for eight years during which he has acquired enough experience that he can create all types of furniture, such as beds, wardrobes, doors, cradles, etc.

Currently, Mr. P. is father to three school-age children who have benefited from their studies thanks to their hard work and desire to get ahead. Today, the Pichardos are looking for a way to improve their economic situation and the business needs an investment in more wood so that Carlos can make more furniture. For this reason, he has applied to Ceprodel for a loan so that he may purchase raw materials and continue his work as always.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos P. es un caballero cuyo negocio es la carpintería el cual se dedica a esta labor desde hace ocho años habiendo adquirido basta experiencia en esta labor ya que realiza todo tipo de muebles como camas, roperos, puertas, cunas de niños, etc.

Actualmente el caballero P. es padre de tres hijos en edades escolares los cuales ha beneficiado con los estudios gracias a su arduo trabajo y ganas de salir adelante. Hoy en día ha buscado la manera de mejorar su situación económica y el negocio requiere la inversión en madera para realizar los muebles. Es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de su materia prima y así continuar en su labor como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.

loans.use: Purchase wood.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. She belongs to the Aleli Village Bank. She owns a store where she sells not only groceries, gas, and various gifts, but also firewood. She has expanded her business in the last few months and bought more display cabinets to better present her products and thus increase the sales volume. Doris currently needs a loan to buy beer, fizzy drinks and gas for sale in her store.

In the future, Doris hopes to expand her house and have a bigger store to earn more income and help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of beer, fizzy drinks, and gas for a retail business

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal C., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Neang Kim, 50, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1982 and have only one daughter who is in school.
 
Mr. Sophal has been a mechanic for twenty eight years. He learned to repair many types of machines during on the job training from his friend in 1980. He started his own business after he got married in 1982. His wife does house work and looks after their daughter.

Sophal is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase some spare machine parts for his stock.

loans.use: To purchase some spare machine parts for his stock.

loans.name: Hidaya's Nia Moja Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 38 years old. She is divorced with 2 children aged 19 and 11 years old. She has been a charcoal and soap seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $220 from her sales.

In the past,Hidaya has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Hidaya is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and soap to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with shop ownership, juice, and firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and soap to expand her business

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom T., 53, and her husband, Mr. Lon Hong, 64, who live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1970 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. One son was married and lives outside the family home. Two daughters are assisting their mother in her grocery business. One son does farming, and the youngest daughter has full-time employment.

Mrs. Sokhom has been a grocery seller since 1980. She buys her supplies from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at her home.
