Her husband grows papayas, tomatoes, corns, and food crops on their farmland. Mrs. Sokhum is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase one motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Aissatou D., 45 ans, mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Aidara depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des thioubs (tissus teintés) en Guinée et au Mali et revendre. Les revenus  tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Aissatou D., 45, married and raising 6 children, has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Aidara for 5 and a half years. She wants to boost her business which consists in buying thioubs (hand-dyed cloth) in Guinea and Mali for re-sale. The income from her business allows her to help out with family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of thioub from Guinea and from Mali

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria, de 47 años de edad vive con su esposo y dos de sus seis hijos. Su dedicación a la venta de comida hicieron que construyera en su propio domicilio su pequeño restaurante, por la misma razón que sus clientes se lo pidieron, con su buena atención y sazón, se gano el cariño y respeto de sus comensales. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar bien para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos. Le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona, muy transitada, le va muy bien. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita en un préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero quiere mandar a refaccionar algunas imperfecciones de su local, así como también, comprar utensilios de cocina (ollas, platos, entre otros).
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and she lives with her husband and two of their six children. Her dedication to selling food meant that they built their own small restaurant in their house. Her clients asked for this as she earns their fondness and respect as she offers good customer service and good seasoning. She has been doing this for two years and what she likes about her job is that cooking well satisfies her clients. It is profitable as it is located in a good area which many people pass through, and it is going well for her. This is the second time that she has asked for a loan through MFP. With this money she wants to make over some parts of her store as well as buying kitchen utensils (pots, plates among other things).


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish her store and buy kitchen utensils/Refaccionar su local y comprar utensilios de cocina

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona B. is 40 years old, and married with four children. She raises hogs and her husband drives a tricycle to  share in the family earnings. All her life Elona has dreamed of having a higher standard of living. She believes she needs to work harder to realize her dreams.

She needs a loan of $225 to purchase pig feed. She wants to take good care her pigs to ensure a profit from her business. She is also interested to find other sources of work to support her husband and children. 

Because Elona is a CEVI  client, she has been provided with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage to help her small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en:
Gullu V. is a very hardworking woman who knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has eight children! 

She works by raising and feeding sheep with the goal of later selling them. This activity makes her feel satisfied, because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding.

She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her youngsters. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce mutton in a quantity sufficient for selling commercially. 

For this reason, she’s requesting a loan of $1200 USD for 15 months to buy 10 sheep and fodder. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Eugenia Faustina

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Eugenia es casada, tiene 51 años y 2 hijos, Eugenia tiene un restaurante en su vivienda, prepara desayuno y almuerzo, actividad que realiza todos los días y cuenta con la ayuda de 4 personas. Además Eugenia alquila su local para diferentes eventos y compromisos.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vitrinas para exhibir sus productos.
Eugenia sueña con tener una galería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Banco Comunal Obreras community bank. She is 51, married, and has 2 children. She has a restaurant in her house where she serves breakfast and lunch every day, with the help of 4 people. Eugenia also rents out her premises for events and celebrations.

She needs a loan of 1400 sol to invest in a display counter to exhibit her products.

Her dream is to have a store and for her children to have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a display counter for her products

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es uno de nuestros clientes más antiguos de la institución, es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre se ha cracterizado por su responsabilidad y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos, todos ellos aun pequeños y en edad escolar.
La actividad a la que se dedica es la de transporte en motocicletas actividad en la cual trabaja hace unos tres años.
El Sr. está muy agradecido con  el microcrédito por que gracias a esto actualmente cuenta con sus herramientas de trabajo, que son sus medios de subsistencia y con lo cual mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is one of the oldest clients of the institution. He is a very hard worker and has always characterized himself by his responsible and timely manner of paying his monthly loan installments. He lives in his own home with his wife and their children who are still young and in school. The activity he has dedicated himself to for the past three years is motorcycle transportation. He is very thankful for the microcredits because, thanks to them, he has tools for his work. This allows him the means by which to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motor.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Since 1998, Fernando O. has been engaged in the hog raising business. He decided to maintain this kind of business because it is really a big help to his family, especially for the upcoming education of his three children. His regular income from his hogs also supports his farming activity, which produces income only twice a year.

To further improve his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00 in order to purchase a supply of feed for his hogs. Fernando believes that through the support of the lenders, his business will progress.

Fernando is 33 years old and married to Alma, a housewife. They are blessed with three kids: Adrian is 5 years old and already in the nursery level; Aubrey is 3 years old; and the youngest is Ashley, who is 2 years old. They are happily living in the village of San Juan, in Alicia, Isabela, a rural area where rice farming is the major source of income of the residents.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his hogs

loans.name: Valijon

texts.en:
D. Valijon has always been hard-working and committed to ensure that his family never goes without its daily bread. He is married, has two children, and runs a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foods. With starting capital of $500, Valijon opened his shop 10 years ago. Since that time, it has continually expanded to the point where his wife (seen here in the photo) also helps out in the shop. Valijon has applied for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional products to sell in his store. He wants prospective lenders to know that he is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices  to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will be key success factors in his small business.   
    
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy additional food products to sell to his customers

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is married. She sells underwear for men and women. Galina invested 10,000 UAH (~ 1200 USD) in her business. She has been in this business for 2 years and wants to develop it further. To do so, she needs to have a larger assortment of underwear. Galina is a very entrepreneurial and hard working person. She would like to borrow 5,000 UAH (USD 625) to purchase more inventory. Galina hopes that the loan will help her to increase the sales and to develop her business.

loans.use: Increase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal B. is 70 years old and lives with his 69-year-old wife in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has a small retail business selling secondhand clothing. He rents a stall in the local market and sells men's and women's secondhand clothes. He travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, once or twice a month and buys secondhand clothes from the wholesale markets. He started his business in 2003 with only 300,000 MNT of working capital (~$215 US) which has increased to 800,000 MNT. In the future, he would like to diversify his inventory. He is requesting a loan to purchase more secondhand clothes.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y carismática, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 queridos hijos, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio es muy concurrido, sobre todo por los niños, tiene una local de videojuegos, el cual le ha dado buenos resultados, ya que le deja el dinero necesario para brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos. Juegos como Tekken, Winning Eleven, Smackdown vs Raw, son los que ofrece a sus clientes, quienes prefieren su local debido a los juegos novedosos y a las máquinas en buen estado que tiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la alegría que sienten los niños al jugar, lleva 10 años en esta actividad, y lo que considera más difícil es controlar a los niños, ya que mucho quieren salir sin pagar, aun así Maria se siente muy feliz con su trabajo. Para un futuro cercano espera incrementar el número de máquinas de videojuego que tiene actualmente. Este es el tercer préstamo de Maria con MFP, en sus primeros créditos ha sido muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará otra máquina de videojuegos, con la cual espera aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hard working and charismatic woman who lives with her two dear children. What she most wishes for is to improve their quality of life. She has a very busy video arcade that is popular with children. This business has produced good returns and provides her with the money to give her children a good education. She has original games like Tekken, Winning Eleven, Smackdown vs Raw so her clients prefer her arcade (also because the machines are in good condition). What she likes most about her business is watching the kids enjoy themselves while they play. She’s been in this business for ten years. The most difficult part for her is controlling the children as many want to leave without paying. Even so, Maria is happy with her job. In the near future, she would like to increase the number of video game machines she has. This is Maria’s third loan with MFP. She was very punctual with her first loans and expects to be again. She is a very lively and responsible member of her communal bank. She will buy another video game machine with the 800 soles asked for and hopes to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una máquina de video juegos

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina D. has been a farmer for seventeen years. She is 37 years old and the mother of seven children. She dreams of sending all her children to school so that when they are older, they will have a better future for their families. 

Her harvest is what she uses to provide the family’s basic needs like food and clothing. She would like to ask a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm needs. She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to improve their harvest. She also dreams to expand her business.

She is happy because she has a partner in running her business. CEVI helps her have a loan. It also provides training and insurance coverage to all its clients to make their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase farm materials like fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Aide

texts.es:
La señora Aidé pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, y tiene estudios de primaria completa.  Vive en el Jr. Junín.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para comprar alimento balanceado para su criadero de truchas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos soles, una parte del dinero lo utilizará en la compra de alimento balanceado para truchas,  y con la otra mitad comprara arroz, papas, chuño, queso carne, condimentos, etc. para su negocio de venta de comida.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y aumentar más jaulas para cría de truchas.

A ella le gusta la puntualidad, los  ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aide is a member of the “Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medallion)” Communal Bank which is located in the District of Pomata, Province of Chucuito, Region of Puno. She is 27 years old, married, has three children, and completed elementary school. She lives on Junin Street.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN which she used to purchase balanced feed for her trout farm. At this time she would like a loan of 1,200 PEN, part of which will be used to purchase balanced feed for the trout, and the rest will be used to purchase rice, potatoes, potato flour, cheese, meat, condiments, etc., for her restaurant business.

She wishes to continue working and to buy more cages for raising trout. She likes the punctuality, savings, and ease of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for the trout; rice, potatoes, potato flour, cheese, meat, and condiments for the restaurant.

loans.name: Everything By God Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of one child who is currently in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop where she sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits in her neighborhood. She lives with the husband and her dear child. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children in school. She believes that with her four years of experience, she can make good use of the loan.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Everything by God." She is the one squatting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are small traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Odgerel B. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 8-year-old daughter in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her husband, who is a carpenter, started a carpentry business in 2006 by purchasing tools costing 480,000 MNT. In their business, her husband does the carpentry work while she paints the products. Because of their high quality and design, the products made by Odgerel and her husband are highly demanded in the local area, and they travel throughout the province to sell their products. They are requesting a loan to purchase pine timbers in order to make more durable and high quality products. This will help them accomplish their two main goals of improving their brand name and growing their business.

loans.use: To purchase pine timbers

loans.name: Janny

texts.es:
Janny es una mujer emprendedora con mucha energía para el trabajo. Tiene 26 años, su principal actividad de trabajo es comprar uña de gato, que es una planta medicinal cuyos poderes curativos son muy eficientes en la salud, ella vende esta corteza a otras personas para su elaboración.
También se dedica en la compra y venta de sandalias, ella ofrece las sandalias en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Pucallpa.
Janny es madre de dos pequeños niños y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en una empresa triplayera . Es socia hace cuatro años del Banco Comunal “Las Colinas”,
Empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles, el cual invirtió en productos de belleza.
En la actualidad ella requiere de un préstamo de 1,200 soles, que invertirá en la compra de  corteza de uña de gato y otra parte la invertirá en comprar sandalias.
La meta de Janny es tener un negocio de todo tipo de adornos para el hogar, juegos de sábanas, colchas, manteles, cortinas,etc.
texts.en:
Janny is an enterprising woman who possesses a lot of energy for her work. She is 26 years old and operates her primary business selling cat’s claw, a medicinal plant known for its curative properties and health benefits. She sells the bark of the plant to others for processing.

Janny also sells sandals, which she sells at different markets in the city of Pucallpa.

She is the mother of two small children and receives the support of her husband, who works at a timber company. Janny has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Colinas” (The Hills) for 4 years. She started with a loan of 300 soles, which was used to buy beauty products.

She currently needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy cat’s claw bark. Part of her loan will also be used to buy sandals.

Her goal is to open a business that sells all types of home furnishings such as sheets, bedspreads, tablecloths, curtains, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cat's claw bark & sandals

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.en:
Yaa is 37 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. 

Yaa is a baker. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Justice. The group members are engaged in either farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.en:
Mr. Tiburcio is 64 years old, is separated, and has five children. All are over 18 and don’t depend on him financially. He is humble and active, and his children help him in his Enterprise.

Mr. Tiburcio started to become an artist, but realized that it wasn’t a marketable profession. He wishes he had a good job and could obtain a good business so he doesn’t have to depend on his children. He wants to create another business  - a service to rent pool tables. With the loan he plans to buy pool tables to rent.

loans.use: To buy pool tables to rent

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita R. is from the village of Cabanglasan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Marita is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Marita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Marita has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann M. is from San Jose Norte 2, Mallig Isabela. She is married to Artemeo M.. They are both 32 years old and have two children. The elder is a boy and he is already studying. The younger one is 1 year old. 

Mary Ann is requesting the amount of 50,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders for additional capital to maintain and improve her store. She started her business selling junk foods in her general store. While she is reaching years in her business, she also achieved improvement in her business and became a dealer of soft drinks in their village. At present, she is selling feed for hogs, liquefied petroleum gas, slippers and other items that are important to their locality for daily consumption.

Her husband accompanied her in delivering the products and also in purchasing goods in the market for their store to minimize expenses. Her husband is the one who will drive their motorcycle and use it for their business. They have also improved their house and have an extension of their kitchen from their income. According to this couple, they have about Php 3,000 weekly net income and they continuously revolve it to the other business. 

One of the dreams of Mary Ann is to improve her business so that someday it will become a grocery shop to help people within their village.

loans.use: Additional capital to maintain and improve her store business

location.town: San Jose Norte II, Mallig, Isabela

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 61 years old. She is married and the mother of ten children. All her children are grown up except her last born, who is still in school. Her husband is a farmer in the community where they live. She works hard to support her husband in providing for the house. 

Grace prepares and bakes bread and runs a grocery shop. She has run both concurrently for seventeen years now. In spite of the challenges she faces, it is her bread and the grocery business that generates an income to support the home. 

Grace takes delivery of stock from Kumasi and sells retail to her customers. She also has customers who come to her to buy in bulk. She bakes in bulk and her customers order from her to sell baked goods with their beverages and other things. 

Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet her demand. She requests a loan to remain in business and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood.

loans.name: Daniel Isaías

texts.es: Daniel Isaías G. de 42 años redice en Colón en el departamento de La libertad, vive junto a su esposa y cinco hijas, de las cuales las dos mayores junto a su madre colaboran en el negocio de su padre. Daniel posee una panadería en la cual se encarga de elaborar y repartir el pan a sus diferentes clientes. Daniel solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración del pan, ya que desea aumentar su producción, beneficio el cual se vea reflejado en el bienestar de su extensa familia.
texts.en:
Daniel Isaías G. is 42 years old, and lives in Colón in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife and five children. The two oldest children, together with their mother, contribute to their father's business. Daniel owns a bakery, where he is in charge of making and delivering the bread to his different customers. Daniel is requesting a loan through which he will be able to buy raw materials for the baking of bread, since he wishes to increase his production, a benefit which will be reflected in the well-being of his extended family.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn M. is  a 39-year-old widow who lives in the village of Prk 9 Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store and selling food. Roselyn has 2 school-age children. The children go to school and also help in the business as part of their daily chores. She wants her children to finish their studies and to improve their living conditions.

Roselyn joined NWTF-Project  Dungganon in 1996 in the hope that she would be able to  improve her family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase her family's income. Now she earns an average monthly income of  Php 4,000 from her business activities.

Roselyn is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,500 was used to fund operations of her general store, and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, she is requesting her 15th loan, in the amount of Php 19,500, which she intends to use for her general store and food vending. Roselyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for general store

loans.name: Aliyu Rose Mary Group

texts.en: Rose M. is the group representative. She is 27 years old and married with one child. She provides tailoring services and she has been doing this business for four years. Since the business is really seasonal, she is using the loan to boost her business by purchasing clothing material for different designs. The business is improving in such a way that she is stocking clothing material to make different designs. She is so encouraging and wishes to work very hard so that she can build a house.

loans.use: To clothing material

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia M. is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal from her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Sadia is 32 years old and is married to a driver. She has five children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr: A. Jocelyne est née le 22 Mai 1965 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. Mais Jocelyne réside depuis environs 30 ans au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Benin. Jocelyne est mariée à AZAGNANDJI Raymond, un entrepreneur, et est mère de quatre enfants.  Tous les enfants de Jocelyne sont scolarisés.  Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille.  Jocelyne a été à l’école jusqu'au secondaire.  Jocelyne vend d’huile à moteur et des tissus qu’elle s’approvisionne à Nigeria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Jocelyne mène cette activité depuis sa naissance. Jocelyne a déjà obtenu des crédits à ALIDé – ces crédits ont été bien remboursés.  Jocelyne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et acheter plus d’huile à moteur.
texts.en:
Jocelyne A. was born on the 22nd of May, 1965, in Abomey, an historic town in Benin. However, Jocelyne has lived in the Cadjehoun quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for the past thirty years. Jocelyne is married to Raymond Azagnandji, an entrepreneur, and has four chlidren. All of Jocelyne´s children attend school, and the couple work together to meet their family´s needs. Jocelyne attended school up to secondary level. She makes a living by selling engine oil and fabric that she sources from Nigeria, Benin´s neighbour. Jocelyne has been involved in this business pratically since birth. She has already received two loans from ALIDé which have both been repaid. Jocelyne is seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to bolster her business and buy more engine oil.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more engine oil

loans.name: Reiman Arturo

texts.es:
Reiman Arturo J. C., tiene la edad de 22 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos.Vive con el papá, la madrastra y dos hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área de pasto idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Reiman tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Reiman Arturo J. C., 22, is single and doesn't have any children. He lives with his father, step-mother and two siblings. He is asking for funds to buy a few calves and to buy feed for them. He wants to provide his cattle with adequate care so that he can get the highest possible sale price. He also wants to increase the number of animals and to be able to keep them in proper conditions. He has an ideal pasturage area suitable for cattle raising. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms that he got. Reiman has been dedicated to cattle raising for several years. He hopes, in the future, to offer his family a better quality of life and better economic stability; he also hopes to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: John Kenagwa

texts.en:
John is a gentleman who is married to a lady called Zepha and they have three children: Teresa, Robert and Hellen. 

John has been in the retail-trade business for seven years and his customers are residents of the place where he also resides.

John joined KADET, a Kiva partner, through existing clients. He has applied for a loan that he intends to use to add stock in his retail shop with things like soap, sugar, cooking fat and other items. He also want to buy a bicycle to assist with transportation as he spends so much money to transport goods. With the extra profits, John will continue to add stock to the business to increase sales. 

John hopes to become a wholesaler in the future and he describes himself as an entrepreneur who is independent and disciplined.

loans.use: To add stock in his retail shop and buy a bicycle

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr: Née en 1965 à Adja au Mono, Y. Rosine vit depuis 25 ans environs à Xwlacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rosine est mariée à EFIO Jean-Marie, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges des enfants. Rosine n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a environs 15 ans que Rosine mène comme activité, la vente de farine de manioc à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Rosine vend également de "sodabi" (boisson alcoolisée locale) à son domicile. Rosine s'approvisionne à Adja. Rosine a bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Rosine sollicite un deuxième prêt, afin d'augmenter le volume de son activité et d'accroître ses sources de revenus. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à ses clients et aussi aux exigences de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Adja in the Mono area, Rosine Y. has been living for the past 25 years in the Xwlacodji area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rosine is married to Jean-Marie EFIO, and is the mother of three children, all having attended (or still attending) school. Rosine herself has not attended school. The couple shares the various child-related expenses. For the past 15 years Rosine has been selling cassava flour from her home. As a side business Rosine also sells “sodabi” (a local alcoholic beverage) from her home. She gets her supplies in Adja. Rosine was already granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. She is now requesting a second loan to expand the volume of her business and extend her sources of income. This will allow her to respond to customer demand and also to her family’s expectations.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of cassava flour

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo tiene 36 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Soledad de 26 años y sus tres queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor vida que la que él tuvo. En el poblado de Churupata, Provincia de Tarma, se encuentran las chacras de Reynaldo, siendo extensas tierras al cual le da el cuidado suficiente, actividad que tiene desde hace 25 años, convirtiendo sus campos de cultivo, mejor producidos del poblado, es por eso que cuando lleva a vender sus cosecha al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, obtiene muy buenos rentas, debido a la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil de esta labor, es cuidar los campos ya sembrados de plagas que afecten su producción. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar los productos que siembra. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo espera continuar siendo puntual con sus pagos, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos que tiene su grupo. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará abono y fertilizantes para mejorar sus campos sembrados.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, age 36, is the very hardworking and responsible head of his family. He lives in his own house together with his 26 year old wife, Soledad, and their three dear children, whom he wants to offer a better life than he has had. Reynaldo has a farm with large fields that he takes care of in the settlement of Churupata, Tarma Province.

He has been a farmer for 25 years and has made his fields the most productive in his community. When he takes his harvest to the wholesale market in the city, he gets very good prices due to the quality of his produce.

What he likes most about his work is planting his land and making it productive. The most difficult part of his work his protecting the planted fields from diseases which affect his crops. In the future, he wants to buy more land in other communities in order to increase his production and vary the crops that he grows.

This is Reynaldo’s seventh loan with MFP, and he hopes to continue making his payments on time since he wants to obtain other loans in the future. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank and is always working towards consensus within the group. With the 1500 soles that he is applying for, he will buy fertilizer for improving his planted fields.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for improving his planted fields.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samuel is 58 years old and is married with three children who go to school. He is mainly into farming business, but also does carpentry work under construction to earn a living. He has been in the business for 10 years and has one employee.  He grows vegetables and rears and fattens pigs to earn enough money to support his family, and pay the school fees for his children.  He saves his money with his group in Faulu Kenya called Mwimuto Success, which enables him to access loans because the group guarantees. He hopes to grow his farming business into large scale and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested for a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds and super growing chemicals for his farming business.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer, seeds and super growing chemicals for his farming business.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
H. Trương Thị (20203050042) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a seven-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 2 - nhóm 08 (8).


H. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. operates a family member's business venture in the services sector providing cargo transport services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately $220 a month from these activities.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous L. was used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  She is now requesting a new L. of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides.  This will be her 2nd L. from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Cao Thị L. (20203050046) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


2.  Trương Thị L. (20203050043) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


3.  Trương Thị M. (20203050044) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050049) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


5.  Trương Thị S. (20203050045) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


6.  Trương Thị L. (20203050096) is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Trương Thị (20203050042) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 2 - nhóm 08 (8).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ vận chuyển hàng hóa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND.  Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị để cải thiện công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Cao Thị L. (20203050046) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Trương Thị L. (20203050043) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Trương Thị M. (20203050044) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050049) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Trương Thị S. (20203050045) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


6.  Trương Thị L. (20203050096) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand her services

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma G. is from the village of Barangay 17, Gundaya, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making snacks and other delicacies and selling them in the local community through peddling. Emma has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Emma joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional materials, such as plastic containers and ingredients needed to make the snack food, and was also used as working capital. Emma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make more snack food for sale. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Barangay 17, Gundaya, Gingoog City, Misamis Orient

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija menor de edad, vive en casa de unos familiares ubicada en el sector Nuevo San Lorenzo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito con mayor población de la región, es a su vez el distrito que tiene mayores índices de pobreza, se caracteriza por su elevado movimiento comercial ya que el mercado mayorista de la región se encuentra ubicado allí.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta ambulante de golosinas y gaseosas en un terminal terrestre ubicado en la zona. Ella ofrece sus productos a los transeúntes de la zona y a los transportistas que cubren las rutas que unen a la ciudad de Chiclayo con los distritos alejados de la provincia de Lambayeque. Este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos, por lo que trata de mantenerse de la mejor manera posible, ofreciendo un buen trato a sus clientes y dándoles productos de calidad.

Elena desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que sus ventas puedan incrementarse y perciba mayores ganancias con las cuales pueda adquirir un nuevo cochecito para mostrar sus productos. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1900 nuevos soles.

Elena es una mujer amable y alegre, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elena is 30 years old, is a single mother, and has a young daughter. She lives in the home of some relatives in the Nuevo San Lorenzo area of the José Leonardo Ortiz district, the district with the highest population in the region. It is at the same time the district with a high poverty level. It is characterized by its high commercial activity, since the region’s wholesale market is located there. For ten years, Elena has been a sweets and soda pop street vendor in a bus station located in the area. She offers her products to the passers by, and to the transporters that cover the routes that unite the city of Chiclayo with distant districts in the Lambayeque province. This work is her only source of income so she tries to comport herself in the best way possible, offering good treatment to her clients and giving them quality products. Elena wants to develop her business by purchasing more products so that her sales will increase. She will use the sales to buy a new cart to display her products. To achieve her objective, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1900 nuevos soles. Elena is an amicable and cheerful woman. In the past, she has worked with Nuestra Instituciíon and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when it was time to assume her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to stock her street vending business

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God is Great” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a  small town in western Sierra Leone. These small-scale entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 3,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses. 
 
The leader of this group is Fatmata D.. Fatmata was born in a town called Kamakwe, in northern Sierra Leone. She is forty-one and is married with four children. Today, Fatmata, her husband, and her children live in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. 

In this small town of Waterloo near Freetown, Fatmata makes a living through selling lace, cottons, etc. With ten years of experience in business, Fatmata wants this loan in order to buy bales of cotton and lace fabrics, etc. to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy bales of cotton and lace fabrics for resale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 30 -year-old dairy farmer.  He has been in this business for five years.  He also offers vehicle break-down services for extra income.  

Paul has been an active member of the Thuita Victory group in Faulu Kenya; he attends the weekly meetings regularly and pays his dues well.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a dairy cow for more production.  He dreams of becoming a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat R. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Marat and his wife operate a food-trading business out of a store in their town. He began his business in 2000 at a rented stall into the local market, where they sold consumer foods. 

His business is very important to his family because it's the only source of income. But thanks to his hard work and his wife's help and support, Marat was able to build a small shop and increase his working capital. Marat is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tukriks loan in order to purchase more supplements from Ulaanbaatar city at wholesales prices.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Janylkan

texts.en: Janylkan A. is a resident of Tup, a nice town in Isykul region with a population of 15,000 people. She is a 52-year-old widow who has raised six sons and a daughter. Her three older sons are married and live separately with their families in Bishkek and the other children live with their mom. Janylkan started her own business in 1994 - at that time she was selling food in the market. Then she saved some money and started to sell clothes. When the children are free they help their mom with her activity. Janylkan hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase school uniforms in order to sell them in autumn, when the school season begins. Also, she will use a part of the loan to purchase convenience goods: five bags of sugar and five bags of macaroni in order to resell them at a higher price in the market. In the future, Janylkan wants to expand her business, improve her family’s living conditions and have enough money to support her children in the future. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms and convenience goods to sell

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania S. is 24, married, and has six children aged between two and eight. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Epifania has two years' experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Epifania joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2009, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Epifania's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Mengbibi

texts.ru: Мирзоева Менгбиби проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 47 лет. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. Арендует торговую точку, где продает овощи, фрукты и масло. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Mengbibi M. lives in the Hamadoni district. She is 47 years old, a widow and has 4 children. She has a secondary education. Mengbibi has been involved in sales at the district's central market for over 5 years. She leases a retail outlet, where she sells vegetables, fruits and oil. She is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: We Too Can Do Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “We Too Can Do” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each person in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Rosaline M. Z.. Rosaline was born in Pujehun 27 years ago. She is single and has three children, two of whom are attending primary school. Rosaline has been selling slippers, sprays, trousers, etc. for three years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy slippers, sprays, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es: Rosa Alba tiene 59 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa usada.  Se dedica desde hace cinco años a este tipo. Eventualmente en su vivienda es donde ofrece la variedad de productos durante todos estos años ha podido hacerse famosa en el rubro y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles. Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito con los que piensa adquirir más ropa variada y lograr su objetivo. Es una persona trabajadora y bastante responsable.  Pues se encuentra muy alegre con esta oportunidad, pues es su primer crédito  y tendrá puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en: Rosa Alba is 59 years old and she sells used clothing. She has had this business for the past 5 years. She makes her sales from her home and she offers a variety of products. During all these years she has made a name for herself and she has earned herself a steady clientele.  She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise. To this end she has requested a loan. With these funds she will acquire a variety of clothing and she will be able to reach her goal. She is a very hard working person and she is very responsible. She is very happy with the opportunity she is granted. This is her first loan and she is committed to the terms of this loan.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Maslandeneh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Maslandeneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Baby M.. Baby is aged thirty-seven and she was born in Matotoka village. She is married with four children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary and secondary schools.  For many years now, Baby has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), and ready-to-wear-clothes. With her share of this loan, she will buy clothes, undervests, etc. in large quantity. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buys clothes, undervests, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Luz Isabel

texts.es:
Luz tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive con sus dos hijos de 18 y 24 años  en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Ella comenzó con una vitrina vendiendo dulces y bebidas, poco a poco fue surtiendo su local con víveres, hasta ahora que tiene una pequeña tienda surtida en la parte delantera de su casa vende dulces, bebidas, granos, enlatados etc. Trabaja desde muy temprano para poder tener tiempo para su familia. 

Ella quiere surtir mas su tienda por eso quiere comprar un congelador y bebidas y así surtir su negocio. En el futuro quiere incrementar su tienda con mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Luz manages a small store in the front part of her home. She lives with her two children (ages 18 and 24) in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area outside of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem.

Luz started with a small display case from which she sold candy and soft drinks. Gradually over time she stocked her store with provisions. Now she has a small store at the front of her house where she sells candy, soft drinks, grain, canned goods, and other items. She starts her work very early so that she can have time to spend with her family.

Luz wants to acquire more inventory for her store, so she plans to buy a freezer and soft drinks for her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her store with more merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes wholesale

loans.name: Vivian's Group

texts.en:
From the village of San Rafael, Roxas, Isabela, Vivian L. is the 38-year-old group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Vivian, who is married and has three school-aged children, owns and operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 16 years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Vivian joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haveing repaid her previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI, she is now requesting her eighth loan for 10000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. Vivian plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli T. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has five children. To make a living, Arceli owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting corn for sale. Arceli also grows hogs for fattening and sale.
Arceli joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Arceli is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm inputs, piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, piglets and feed

loans.name: Claudio Gerardo

texts.es:
Claudio Gerardo R. M. tiene 38 años, vive en Unión Libre con su esposa e hijos,  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos de diferentes edades. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. DIVINO NIÑO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Claudio Gerardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que su hija estudie

Le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Claudio Gerardo R. M. is 38 years old; he lives with his common-law spouse and their children in the canton of Ventanas, in the Los Rios province. They have 4 children of varying ages. 

The members of the communal bank "Devine Infant" is located in the community of Estero Lindo in Ventanas. It is a group of 12 members who are short-term agriculturists who plant corn and rice. 

Claudio Gerardo is an agriculturist who plants corn and rice. He purchases his products in Farma-Agro and resells them in the same location. 

He requests a loan to purchase corn, rice, and to purchase materials and seeds. This loan will support him financially, allowing him to meet his needs and to face the difficult challenges of plagues, illness, and the changing weather. His dream is to see his daughter attend school. 

He enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: To purchase products and seeds.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر 49 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد يعمل في بيع الخبز متجول له في عمله 3 سنوات يحب عائلته ويريد لها العيش الكريم
السليم يريد دائما التجدد والتطور له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض السابق في دعمه ماديا وكان يلقى الدعم من عائلته وخاصة اولاده حيث وجدوا ان والدهم يتطور في عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تجديد وصيانة الفان خاصته
يتميز بالمثابرة والجدية في العمل يريد توسيع المصلحة وتقويتها حتى يتمكن من تحسين وضعه ووضع عائلته المادي والاجتماعي
texts.en:
Muhammad is 49 years old, married with four children. He has been working as a baker for three years. He loves his family very much and wants a stable and comfortable life for them. He is always looking for ways to develop his business. He has good credit history with A.-Majmoua as the previous loan supported him financially. He has support from his family, especially his children who found their father was developing his work. With the requested loan from A.-Majmoua he hopes to renew and repair his oven. He is persevering and determined in his work.
He wants to expand and strengthen his interests, thereby improving his and his family’s financiA. and sociA. situation.

loans.use: For maintenance work on bakery oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his store and calves for breeding

loans.name: Dennis Christian

texts.es:
Dennis Christian Z. V. tiene 32 años,  vive en el Departamento de Santa Cruz, es soltero no tiene hijos, trabaja desde hace 6 años en el Banco Union, tiene muchos sueños de superación, vive con su tia, desde que estuvo en la Universidad se pago sus estudios solo, asi logro con el tiempo obtener su titulo, cuando estudiaba ya trabajaba, estudio siempre en la Universidad estatal.

Dennis es una persona muy responsable que ahora ha logrado ahorrar un dinerito y desea invertir en algo importante y se le ha presentado una oportunidad para realizar estudios superiores, pero los costos para este tipo de estudios son muy altos por ello accedió a un plan de pagos donde le piden una cuota inicial que si le conviene por este motivo es que solicita un crédito para pagar un parte de la cuota inicial y con sus ahorros podrá pagar el saldo requerido, con el fin de adquirir mas conocimiento a nivel profesional.
 
Dennis espera con muchas ansias lograr sus metas de superación, con el tiempo poder ejercer sin inconvenientes su profesión.
texts.en:
Dennis Christian Z. V., 32, lives in Santa Cruz department.  He’s single and has no children.  He’s worked for the last 6 years at Unión Bank.  His dream is of self-improvement.  He lives with his aunt.  He’s paid for his university studies himself.  This is how he obtained his degree.  When he was studying he was already working.  He always went to the state university.

Dennis is a very responsible person who has now managed to save up a little money.  He wants to invest in something worthwhile and he’s been presented with an opportunity for higher education but the costs of this type of studies are very high.  He agreed to a payment plan where he is required to pay an initial down payment.  He feels that it would suit his purpose so is asking for a loan to pay part of this initial payment; he will use his savings to cover the rest of it.  His aim with this is to acquire advanced professional knowledge.

Dennis is very anxious to reach his self-improvement goals in order to practice his profession in time problem-free.

loans.use: To pay higher education expenses.

loans.name: C2389 Dukundumurimo Group

texts.en:
Adrienne is 67 years old and is married with five children who are between 12 and 28 years old. Adrienne's business is well-known which is an advantage for her. Adrienne is the leader of a group which is called "Dukundumurimo", consisting of five women and one man. In the photo, Adrienne is the first person on the right side.

Adrienne and her group has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a additional vegetables and fruits for increasing her profits. If successful, she will be able to reinvest in her fruit and vegetables business. In the long term, Adirenne hopes that her investment will enable her to accrue savings in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto G. Godínez, tiene la edad de 47 años de edad, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El pretende comprar con el dinero los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno y el cultivo en buenas condiciones por lo cual quiere asistirlo para esta próxima cosecha llegar a tener mayores ingresos y producciones al igual mejorar  su calidad de producción. El cuenta con mucha experiencia en esta área del café y también quiere crecer como caficultor de la zona y generar ingresos para su bienestar y el de sus padres. 
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rigoberto G. Godínez, 47, is single living with his parents.  He intends to use the money to buy farming supplies for his coffee crops.  He has the land and the plants in good condition so he wants to assist them so that the next harvest will produce higher income and crop yields as well as to improve the quality of his products.  He has a lot of experience growing coffee and he also wants to grow as a coffee producer in the area thus generating income for his and his parents’ wellbeing.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He hadn’t had any previous loans in state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with the best terms and an interest rate that is much lower.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (general store) business. She has operated this business for two years and earns an additional income from phone e-loading. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. 

Miriam has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her previous loans from NWTF. She aspires eventually to repair and renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy more items to offer for sale in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Jeanned’Arc

texts.en:
Jeanne D’arc is a 39-year-old widow with two children who are seven and 12 years old. Both of her children are in school. Jeanne sells second-hand clothing for children and adults. Her business has enabled her pay her children’s school and medical fees. 

Jeanne is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es: Aquilina de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Alcides de 46 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 06 hijos, a quienes desea brindarle una buena educación. Aquilina es bien conocida en su entorno, desde muy temprano alista sus herramientas de trabajo para afrontar un nuevo día. Camina rápido hacia sus campos verdes, ahí cultiva plantas de cacao, café y frutas como: piña y plátano, productos que con mucho esfuerzo logró tornarlas muy productivas. Hoy sus cultivos están trabajadas de manera tecnificada gracias al apoyo y a las capacitaciones que recibe de los Ingenieros Agrónomos. Pero su dificultad radica en no poder combatir con la moniliasis y la broca, enfermedades que atacan en los frutos cacao y café, es por eso que acude a los créditos de MFP para poder comprar trampas e insecticidas y así poder combatir la plaga de insectos que asechan  sus cultivos. Para el futuro y para el bien de su familia piensa comprar más espacios de terreno. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, menciona que este aporte le será de mucha utilidad y esta apto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará trampas e insecticidas.
texts.en: Aquilina, 40 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her 46-year old husband Alcides and their six children, who they want to provide with a good education. Aquilina is well-known in her neighborhood. At an early hour she prepares her work tools and walks quickly to her green fields where she grows cocoa, coffee, and fruits like pineapples and plantains. With a lot of hard work she has made these plants productive. Now her crops are grown with technical expertise thanks to the support and training she receives from agronomists. Her difficulty is in combatting moniliasis and the bit, which are plagues that attack cocoa and coffee. This is why she is requesting a loan from MFP. She will buy traps and insecticides to battle the plague of insects which are destroying her crops. In the future she hopes to buy more land for the benefit of her family. This is her first loan with MFP, and she says that the loan will be of great use, and that she will make her payments on time because she wants access to further loans in the future. With the 1,500 new soles she will buy insect traps and insecticide.

loans.use: purchase insect traps and insecticides to combat plagues

loans.name: Taman Indah Group

texts.en:
Taman Indah group will repay this loan according to mutual agreement and will be re-applying for loans for the next period to MUK. 

Ni Wayan is the chairman of the Taman Indah group. Ni Wayan lives with her husband and daughter, who is still in junior high school. Ni Wayan's portion of the current loan is 1,400,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR). Half of that will be used to buy two piglets for fattening (350,000 IDR each) and the rest to buy the feed. The piglets will be maintained for five months and then be ready for sale. 

She hopes from the results of this pig farming that the business will grow. She plans to use the profits to supplement the family's income and repay the loan from MUK. 

Ni Wayan is in the front row, second from right, wearing colorful clothing with a flower motif.

loans.use: To buy two piglets for fattening

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en: Dilara is a hardworking woman who runs her agriculture business raising crops. Her father taught her the best ways to care for her land and is now actively helping her. Dilara is 45 years old. For six years, Dilara has been running her vegetable and fruit farming business. She cultivates potatoes, carrots, tomatoes and cucumbers. With the profit she plans to expand her business and buy more seeds and fertilizer. Dilara would like to get a loan of 1300 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva was born in 1953 and she lives in Gandzakar village in the Tavush region. She is married and has 4 children who are already married. Silva’s younger son’s family lives with Silva. 

For about 20 years Silva worked for a carpet manufacturer as a storekeeper. Since 1993 she has engaged in pig keeping and hothouse farming. In her hothouse she generally grows verdure for sale. Silva’s husband works as a sawmill operator, but he also helps his wife in her occupation. Thus, Silva solves a part of her family’s needs.  

Silva needs a 700,000 AMD loan to buy pig fodder and to repair her hothouse.

loans.use: To buy pig fodder and to repair her hothouse.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME 3  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et  en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  KARIATOU YOUSSOUF, qui est la première assise à gauche,  compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir environs 0,7  hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguisseme 3 group are married women, on average 44 years old with 2 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the town of Massigui in the Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region in Mali.
