They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they grow include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan collaboration with the institution.
With this new loan, Kariatou Youssouf, sitting all the way on the left in the photo, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and pay for labour costs to manage about 0.7 hectares of rice and peanuts.
After the harvest, the produce is sold town-wide in Missagui to a clientele composed of men and women. Each member intends to realize an average profit of about 70,000 FCFA at the end of the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel de Jesús, es soltero y vive en un lugar muy bonito en donde las personas se dedican a bordar mantas.

   El solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de pan, en donde lleva  tres años y cuatro meses y comenta que le va bien ya que su  mama la apoya en la entrega de  los panes y también en la elaboración.

    El  se motivo a esta actividad ya  que salió  en busca de trabajo a san Cristóbal de la casas y encontró en una panadería y le gusto este tipo de trabajo y decidió practicarlo y tener su propio negocio en su comunidad y le ha dado buen resultado.

    Lo que más desea es que con el tiempo pueda tener más grande su panadería para que con el tiempo pueda ser  distribuidor de  las tienda en tragando panes y así  también apoyar a otras personas daño les empleo para que se ayuden entre sí.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesus is single and lives in a very pretty place where many people make a living embroidering blankets.  

He is applying for a loan so that he can buy ingredients for making bread.  He's operated the business for three years and four months.  He says that he's been successful because his mother helps make and deliver the bread.

He got the idea for the business after looking for a job in San Cristobal de Las Casas.  He met a baker there and liked the work, so he decided to start a bakery in his own town.  So far, so good.

He wants to develop the business and become a distributor to stores that sell bread.  He also wants to provide jobs to other people so that they can help one another.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his bakery business.

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es: “San Carlos” es una alcancía comunal integrada por 7 personas responsables y emprendedoras las cuales trabajan bien con el programa. Violeta tiene 51 años de edad, su familia la conforman su esposo y sus dos hijos. Violeta se dedica al negocio de confecciones de calzados , empezó en el negocio hace 20 años, incursiono en este rubro debido a que trabajaba para terceras personas, de esta manera fue que aprendió el negocio, el deseo de progresar la llevo a que Violeta realice la confección de los zapatos por su cuenta en su hogar, para así poder tener mas ingresos económicos y sacar a sus hijos a delante pudiendo ellos llegar a ser unos profesionales, lo que ha logrado gracias al negocio ha sido construir su casa ya que ella indica que era unos de los sueños que tiene ,otro de los sueños que desea lograr es incursionar también en el negocio de la confección de ropa, el reciente préstamo lo desea utilizar para adquirir mas material y así poder confecciona mas calzado y poder hacer su sueño realidad. La alcancía comunal “San Carlos” agradece su ayuda.
texts.en: San Carlos” is a community bank with seven responsible and entrepreneurial members. They all work well with this program. Violet is 51 years old. Her family includes her husband and their two children. Violet makes shoes. She started this business 20 years ago. After training with another shoemaker, she ventured into this field of work. In this way she learned the business. A desire to progress allowed Violet to start making shoes on her own in her home. This way she can have more earnings and help her children progress. She wants her children to be professionals. Thanks to her business she was able to build their house. That was one of the dreams that she had. Her other dream is to start making clothes. With this loan she would like to buy more material in order to make more shoes. In this way she can realize her dream. The “San Carlos” Community Bank thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy material to make shoes.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Maricar peddles a variety of fish like sardines & mackerel using her pedicab. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Maricar has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, de 31 años, vive junto a su pareja en casa de sus padres junto a ellos y sus hermanos.El trabajo de Sandra consiste en salir a buscar clientes (amigos y familiares) y venderles ropa. Ella tiene un proveedor que le envía las mejores prendas desde la ciudad de Lima. Sandra se encarga de colocarlos acá en su ciudad entre sus amigos y familiares, para después cobrar de manera semanal. Lleva solo algunos meses en este negocio, lo hace sola y espera poder crecer poco a poco en este negocio.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente cómoda ya que es independiente y dispone del tiempo que ella desea, espera no encontrarse con deudores en el futuro.Este es el segundo préstamo entre Sandra y la institución MFP, se siente muy cómoda en su grupo ya que pertenece a unos de los grupos mas sólidos de la institución, espera poder seguir trabajando con la institución ya que le agrada que le cobran bajos interés y le den la oportunidad de salir adelante por su cuenta.Con los 1000 soles solicitados, ella comprará mercaderías para que siga en su negocio ya que espera poder crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra, 31, lives with her partner in her parents’ house with them and her siblings.  Sandra’s work consists in going out seeking customers (friends and relatives) to sell them clothes.  She has a supplier that sends her the best articles of clothing from the city of Lima.  Sandra takes care of selling them here in her city among her friends and relatives; she collects weekly payments.  She’s only been in business a few months.  She works alone and expects to be able to grow gradually in the business.  What she likes about it is that she feels comfortable because it’s independent and she can use her time however she likes.  She hopes not to run into debtors in the future.

This is the second loan between Sandra and MFP.  She feels very comfortable in her group because she belongs to one of the most solid groups in the institution.  She hopes to be able to continue working with the institution because it pleases her that they charge low interest rates and give her the opportunity to get ahead on her own.  She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy merchandise to stay in business since she hopes to be able to grow in this business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Bernita

texts.en:
Bernita is 58 years old and widowed. She is currently living with her nieces because she doesn't have children.

Bernita has been operating a tailoring business for almost 21 years in their village. According to her, she is getting older and yet she would like to improve her business by putting up a dress shop and store in front of her house so that she could encourage more customers. Due to her determination in life, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy materials needed to put up her dress shop and garments for her tailoring business.
 
She hopes that she can obtain her loan request so that she can establish her dress shop and store. She believes that through her business, she could sustain her daily needs and save for her security purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy materials to open a dress shop and to buy garments for her tailoring business

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en:
Dioscoro is 41 years old and is a married man with three children. The oldest child is 19 years old. Dioscoro makes and sells "tuba" (coconut wine) for a living. He has a coconut farm, which is the source of his coconut wine. Dioscoro works hard to improve his business and support his family.

Dioscoro has requested this loan to purchase containers and other materials. He hopes for his business to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase containers and other materials

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela, de 32 años habita en el centro poblado Unión Autiki. Ahí formó su familia, junto a Santiago, su esposo desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Leslie y Jefferson a los que cuida en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer líder y con muchas cualidades. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo y la lejanía de su zona, por ello asoció a varias mujer como ella para crear su banco comunal. Donde puedan progresar con el apoyo financiero que les brinda. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura; siembra maíz y plátanos en los 2 terrenos productivos que alquila durante el año. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son los tiempos de cosecha de café, pues obtiene buenas ganancias en está temporada. Cuenta que viaja a diferentes lugares, donde buscan peones que ayuden en la recolección del grano y como ella es muy hábil para ello le pagan muy bien por cada arroba que logra recoger. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia en la agricultura y espera ahorrar lo necesario para comprar sus propios terrenos de cultivo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde están segura logrará sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Daniela de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 20 kilos de semilla de maíz para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Daniela, 32, lives in the town of Unión Autiki.  There she formed her family with Santiago, her husband of ten years.  Together they have two children: Leslie and Jefferson, who they care for in their own home.  She is a female leader with many qualities.  Her main difficulties are the lack of working capital and the remoteness of her area, so she partnered with several women like her to create a community bank, where they can move ahead with the financial support it offers them.  

Her main economic activity is farming.  She plants corn and bananas in the two fields she rents during the year.  The thing she likes best about her work is coffee harvest time, because she earns a good income during that time.  She says she travels to different places where she looks for laborers to help with the grain collection.  Since she is skillful, she pays them very well for each arroba (unit of weight between 24 and 36 pounds) they collect.  She has seven years of experience farming, and she hopes to save up the necessary funds to purchase her own fields.  

She is a member of the community bank Mujeres Unidas (Women United), and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is sure she will achieve her objectives.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Daniela will use this loan to purchase 20 kilos of corn seeds for her next planting.

loans.use: to purchase 20 kilos of corn seeds.

loans.name: Jose Osmin Galileo

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad, el administra una ladrillera, lo comenzó  hace diez años, trabaja de lunes a sábado, no tiene un horario establecido.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar ladrillos (leña y tierra) pues los ladrillos de José son artesanales, hechos de tierra y quemados en un horno, este prestamo surge debido que tiene mucha demanda y también para poder mejores ingresos.
El sueño de José es contratar más personal para elaborar ladrillos y será fácil  entregar el producto a tiempo y que su familia viva en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and two children, aged 9 and 12. He manages a brick factory which he started up ten years ago. He works from Monday to Saturday although he doesn't have a fixed schedule.

He needs the loan to purchase materials to make bricks (firewood and earth). Jose's bricks are artisan bricks which are made with earth and fired in an oven. This loan is required for the increased demand and to improve his income.

Jose's dream is to hire more personnel to make bricks. It would be easier to deliver the products on time and it would improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and earth to make bricks.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga pertenece al banco comunal “San José D. Urubamba” D. la ciudad D. Urubamba. Las reuniones D. las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Urubamba D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Dominga vive en la ciudad D. Urubamba y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal D. Dominga es la venta D. comida en la ciudad D. Huayllabamba ósea a la ciudad esta a unos 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Dominga requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, verduras, menestras, cereales y otras cosas más. 

Dominga agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Dominga belongs to the San José D. Urubamba communal bank in the city of Urubamba. Every month, the members of the communal bank meet in Urubamba, which is in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cuzco.

Dominga lives in the city of Urubamba, where she engages in economic activities. Her principle economic activity is to sell food in the city of Huayllabamba, which is about 15 minutes from Urubamba. She has spent several years in this business, and it continues to go well for her.

At this time, Dominga needs a loan to purchase ingredients, such as rice, vegetables, beans, grains, and other items, for example.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients, such as, rice, vegetables, beans, grains, and other items, for example.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo's greatest dream in life, is for his family to have a better quality of life. He works hard to be able to attain it. He believes that sending his children to school, so they may pursue their degrees, is the best opportunity that he can give his children.

Leonardo is 29 years of age, married and blessed with two children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper. They work and help each other to reach his dream. Leonardo engages in a hog raising business, which is his family's source of income. Leonardo wants to maintain his business because he believes that it will help him attain his dream and wishes. He is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
This is Trinidad, 55, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Erlito, a maintenance staff person, and mother to her five children .She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Trinidad operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Trinidad hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger(mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a chauffeur, her son (who lives with her) is a school student and her other three children are employed and live independently. 

She started her foodcourt business in 2010 by renting a space in the market. Now that her kids are grown, she wants to expand her business by purchasing equipment worth 500,000 MNT. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I had no chance to expand my business when my children were young and I had to support them. Now that they are grown and independent, I will concentrate on my business".

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 2 children and her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.

She has retail shop and also sells water at the market. She has been in business for 3 years. She also has rental houses as her other source of income. She works six days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour and sugar. Her major business challenge is the change in prices of commodities, electricity and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses and also own a fully stocked shop. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 and is separated. She lives in the Philippines and is a farmer who cultivates bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. Jane has been a member of GDMPC for four years.

Jane is requesting a 4,870 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she hopes to improve and  expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Marlon

texts.es: Marlon de 34 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías con las cuales ha logrado apoyar el bienestar de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 5 a 11 años. Su negocio lo inició en el año 2000,  aunque su experiencia como comerciante  la inició desde el año 1997. Su negocio es atendido por él y por su cónyuge,  desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde diariamente. Sus principales clientes son los peatones, trabajadores ubicados alrededor del negocio,  jóvenes interesados en calcomanías y con su competencia muy cerca a él,   genera clientes potenciales a su negocio. En la actualidad planea su crecimiento, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente,  para apoyar con nuevo surtido la mercancía que usualmente rota más rápido. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará hilos para tejer, acero, piedras, totumos y semillas, con las cuales fabricará diversos diseños de accesorios femeninos y masculinos, en los cuales ha trabajado para responder a sus compradores. La inversión resultará exitosa porque la hará en una época de gran movilidad comercial, en la cual hay mucha rotación de dinero, por efecto de las primas y bonificaciones de los empleados de empresas que son sus principales clientes.
texts.en:
Marlon is 34 years old. He works creating and selling artisanal crafts, a job that has allowed him to support the wellbeing of his family, made up of his partner and their three children between 5 and 11 years old. He began this business in the year 2000, but his experience in sales began in 1997. 

The craft business is tended by both Marcelo and his partner from 10:00 in the morning to 5:00 in the afternoon every day. Their main customers are pedestrians, workers who are located near the business, and young people who are interested in artistic decals. With competition close by his business, he is able to generate potential customers for his business. 

Marlon is currently planning to grow his business, but his working capital is not sufficient to support a new assortment of merchandise that rotates more often. He is applying for his first loan through Kiva, with which he will buy fibers for weaving, steel, stones, toturnos (a type of gourdlike fruit), and seeds, with which he will make different accessories for men and women that he has designed with his buyers' comments in mind. The investment will be successful, because he will be expanding at a time of great commercial mobility, in which there is a lot of moving around of money because of prizes and bonuses given to the the employees at nearby business, who are his principal clients.

loans.use: to purchase yarn for weaving, steel, stones, totumos, and seeds.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La Sra. Zulma tiene 54 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, es casada, tiene 2  hijos, el mayor de 24 años y el menor de 16 años.
La Sra. Zulma se dedica a la venta de bebidas y comestibles en su Despensa, hace aproximadamente 10 años. Comenzó con un puesto en el mercado de la cuidad de Limpio donde vendía verduras y frutas. Con el tiempo pudo abrir una despensa en su domicilio y dejó su puesto en el mercado. Su meta es seguir progresando de la misma forma y como ha podido salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, cervezas, gaseosas, vino, comestibles, arroz, azúcar, yerba, harina, aceite y demás insumos para poder abastecerse.
texts.en:
Zulma, 54, is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. She is married and has 2 children - the elder is 24 and the younger is 16. Zulma has been selling drinks and food products in her grocery store for about 10 years. She started with a stall in the market in Limpio where she sold fruits and vegetables. Over time she was able to open a store in her home and leave her market stall. Her goal is to keep progressing this way and to get ahead. 

She requests a loan to buy drinks like beer, soda and wine; and food products like rice, sugar, tea, flour, oil and other things to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy drinks like beer, soda, and wine; and food products like rice, sugar, tea, flour, oil and other things.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali J. is 49 years old. He is married and has a son who is 24 years old. Previously Ali has been a bus driver in Kardjali and his wife has been a nurse. In 2004 they found a small farm on which they breed 20 cows now. Because the winter is coming Ali J. wants to buy some fodder for his cows and needs $ 1 000.

loans.use: To buy some fodder
